commit_message:
Introduce container composition

This spec proposes to introduce a new API object 'capsule' to Zun.
Capsule represents a tightly coupled unit of containers and other
resources like sandbox. The containers in a capsule work closely
together to form a cohesive unit of service.

Part of blueprint introduce-compose

Co-authored-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>
Change-Id: I608d4c7c3141d9529202efafe149f9e74f5fcc4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/59/437759/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================== Container Composition ===================== Related Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/introduce-compose Docker compose[1] is a handy tool to compose multiple containers into one unit. This spec proposes to support a similiar feature in Zun, we can put multiple containers, a sandbox and other related resources into one unit, we name the unit ``capsule``. The containers in a ``capsule`` are relatively tightly coupled, they shares the capsule's context like Linux namespaces, cgroups and etc, and they work together closely to form a cohesive unit of service. Problem description =================== ddd Proposed change =============== 1. Introduce a new abstraction called ``capsule``. It represents a tightly coupled unit of multiple containers and other resources like sandbox. The containers in a capsule shares the capsule's context like Linux namespaces and cgroups. 2. Support the CRUD operations against capsule object, capsule should be a basic unit for scheduling and spawning. To be more specific, all containers in a cpasule should be sheduled to and spawned on the same host. 3. Support docker compose file....................<kevinz> The diagram below offers an overview of the architecture of ``capsule``: :: +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | +-----------+ | | | | | | | Sandbox | | | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | | +-------------+ +-------------+ +-------------+ | | | | | | | | | | | Container | | Container | | Container | | | | | | | | | | | +-------------+ +-------------+ +-------------+ | | | | | | +----------+ +----------+ | | | | | | | | | Volume | | Volume | | | | | | | | | +----------+ +----------+ | | | +-----------------------------------------------------------+ Alternatives ------------ <kevinz> Data model impact ----------------- * Create a 'capsule' table. Each entry in this table is a record of a capsule. REST API impact --------------- * Add a new API endpoint /capsules to the REST API interface. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Wenzhi Yu <yuywz> Other contributors: Kevin Zhao <kevinz> Work Items ---------- 1. Implement a new API endpoint for capsules. 2. Implement unit/integration test. 3. Document the new capsule API. Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Each patch will have unit tests, and Tempest functional tests covered. Documentation Impact ==================== A set of documentation for this new feature will be required. References ========== [1] https://docs.docker.com/compose/

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Ie954a0fb0a0eaf6e23a1bf9a846c4fd665606acc
Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
Remove deprecated oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport

DeprecationWarning:
Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport.

Change-Id: I6026c8f80f75004b18dc6cb9948b58d98080fca9

commit_message:
Don't pass argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated for removal[1], and isn't used in
both oslo.db and Nova, so don't need set its default value.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/\
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2/oslo_db/options.py#L17

Change-Id: I4cd84f1750ed7cf6c595cec6d6f52b79c73c311b
(cherry picked from commit 103f13e37f1fc5ad8cf3cfefd66898d62772077c)

commit_message:
[ci][samples] Try to speed up checking samples

The validation of all samples takes too much time. It is an attempt to
speed up the check by using broker pattern (validate several samples in
parallel).

Change-Id: I370ad1a67506fee0800783b5ed2ba1beab890f98

from rally.common import broker NUMBER_OF_THREADS = 20 failed_samples = {} def publisher(queue): samples_path = os.path.join( os.path.dirname(rally_module.__file__), os.pardir, "samples", "tasks") for dirname, dirnames, filenames in os.walk(samples_path): # NOTE(rvasilets): Skip by suggest of boris-42 because in # future we don't what to maintain this dir if dirname.find("tempest-do-not-run-against-production") != -1: for filename in filenames: full_path = os.path.join(dirname, filename) # NOTE(hughsaunders): Skip non config files # (bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1314369) if os.path.splitext(filename)[1] != ".json": continue with open(full_path) as task_file: queue.append((full_path, rendered_task)) def consumer(_cache, sample): full_path, rendered_task = sample task_config = yaml.safe_load(rendered_task) try: rapi.task.validate("MAIN", task_config) except Exception as e: if not self._skip(six.text_type(e)): failed_samples[full_path] = traceback.format_exc() broker.run(publisher, consumer, self.NUMBER_OF_THREADS) if failed_samples: self.fail("Validation failed on the one or several samples. ======%s" % "".join(["======

commit_message:
Don't pass argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated for removal[1], and isn't used in
both oslo.db and Nova, so don't need set its default value.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/\
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2/oslo_db/options.py#L17

Change-Id: I4cd84f1750ed7cf6c595cec6d6f52b79c73c311b

commit_message:
[Share Groups] Fix creation of share group types with wrong specs values

If we provide some other type than None or dict as group specs
creating share group type, then we get error 500 caused by unhandled
exception. So, avoid it by explicitly checking type of provided group
specs.

Change-Id: I81312617f37a8f559b3c9201b03cf8be31761365
Closes-Bug: #1673446

commit_message:
[Rally] fix jobs

`Dummy.dummy` scenario doesn't relate to openstack anymore, so there are
no data for launching openstack related contexts. `Dummy.openstack` should
be used instead.

Change-Id: I63d3cb2379deafc2b6a59e66c236149dfd9f6c16
(cherry picked from commit 0a634dccc2565e882538fc388526c3a037a33871)

subject: Fix the depends-on gating for basic.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 11:27:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/08d40fc86a9d5b7f94b129c4f44bdbf500b2df63', 'message': "Fix the depends-on gating for basic.sh

The gate-quickstart role uninstalls the 'tripleo-quickstart-extras'
package from the virtual env if it find a change for it, while modifying
the quickstart-extras-requirements.txt to get it reinstalled from the
locally checked out version with the next run. That run requires the
--bootstrap option to rerun the pip commands and reinstall. This was
missing from basic.sh

The previous workaround is not needed which manually installed the repo.

Change-Id: I65a1b286a03e9f039c75b930e3eca5ceedeb0fd6
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-08 11:31:33.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/basic.sh', 'ci-scripts/include-gate-changes.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/81574cf4532fa42ef22cc8b995e173d3bc50f60d', 'message': "Fix the depends-on gating for basic.sh

The gate-quickstart role uninstalls the 'tripleo-quickstart-extras'
package from the virtual env if it finds a change for it, while
modifying the quickstart-extras-requirements.txt to get it reinstalled
from the locally checked out version with the next run. That run
requires the --bootstrap option to rerun the pip commands and reinstall.
This was missing from basic.sh.

The previous workaround is not needed which manually installed the
repo. Removing the workaround fixes a bug that broke devmode.sh.

Closes-bug: #1696532
Change-Id: I65a1b286a03e9f039c75b930e3eca5ceedeb0fd6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the depends-on gating for basic.sh

The gate-quickstart role uninstalls the 'tripleo-quickstart-extras'
package from the virtual env if it finds a change for it, while
modifying the quickstart-extras-requirements.txt to get it reinstalled
from the locally checked out version with the next run. That run
requires the --bootstrap option to rerun the pip commands and reinstall.
This was missing from basic.sh.

The previous workaround is not needed which manually installed the
repo. Removing the workaround fixes a bug that broke devmode.sh.

Closes-bug: #1696532
Change-Id: I65a1b286a03e9f039c75b930e3eca5ceedeb0fd6

Add initial spec for mistral-lib

This is a new dependency for mistral going forward.

Change-Id: I896f89705f4eb8d908c77e806afd698b2ef9befc

[arch-guide] Adding arch guidance to storage design

Update information about object storage replication.

Change-Id: Ic1bdaa50569711b9e7c8fb0b8fe8c3a2160c027e
Implements: blueprint arch-design-pike
Partial-Bug: #1676238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/98/463098/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Performance of block based storage is typically measured in the maximum read and write operations to non-contiguous storage locations per second. This measurement typically applies to SAN, hard drives and solid state drives. While IOPS can be broadly measured and is not an official benchmark, many vendors like to used by vendors to communicate performance levels. Since there are no real standards for measuring IOPS, vendor test results may vary, sometimes wildly. Howver, along with transfer rate which measures the speed that data can be transferred contiguous storage locations, IOPS can be used in a performance evaluation. Typically transfer rate is represented by a bytes per second calculation but IOPS is measured by an integer. To calculate IOPS for a single drive you could use: IOPS = 1 / (AverageLatency + AverageSeekTime) For example: Average Latency for Single Disko = 2.99ms or .00299 seconds Average Seek Time for Single Disk = 4.7ms or .0047 seconds IOPS = 1/(.00299 + .0047) IOPS = 130 To calculate maximum IOPS for a disk array Maximum Read IOPS: In order to accurately calculate maximum read IOPS for a disk array simply multiply the IOPS for each disk by the maximum read or write IOPS per disk. maxReadIOPS = nDisks * diskMaxIOPS For example, 15 10K Spinning Disks would be measured the following way: maxReadIOPS = 15 * 130 maxReadIOPS = 1950 Maximum Write IOPS per Array Determining the maximum *write* IOPS is a little different because most administrators configure disk replication using RAID and since the RAID controller requires IOPS itself, there is a write penalty. The severity of the write penalty is determined by the type of RAID used. =========== ========== Raid Type Penalty ----------- ---------- 1 2 5 4 10 2 =========== ========== Note: Raid 5 has the worst penalty (has the most cross disk writes) Therefore, using the above examples, a 15 disk array using RAID 5 is capable of 1950 read IOPS however, we need to add the penalty when determining the *write* IOPS: maxWriteIOPS = 1950 / 4 maxWriteIOPS = 487.5 A RAID 5 array only has 25% of the write IOPS of the read IOPS while a RAID 1 array in this case would produce a maximum of 975 IOPS.
deleted_lines: The latency of storage I/O requests indicates performance. Performance requirements affect which solution you choose.

commit_message:
Add module apply usage guide

This guide can be useful for those who need to apply software
modules to their databases like updates, external packages,
or probably the most common case, licensing.

This guide would have not been possible without the help of
Peter, he wrote this guide for me when I asked for help in
a review. I've been sitting on it for some time and made
all the necessary formatting changes, minor edits, as well as
reperformed all the steps so the output is accurate.

Note: I was admin when making this guide so there are fields
that aren't normally visible to the user.

Change-Id: I784b344adb29382287052c1aedaf7f96656adb8b
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Co-Authored-By: chenxing <chen.xing@99cloud.net>
Closes-Bug: #1669050
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/04/470404/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _database_module_usage: ===================================== Create and use modules for a database ===================================== Assume that you have installed the Database service and populated your data store with images for the type and versions of databases that you want, and that you can create and access a database. This example shows you how to create and apply modules to a MySQL 5.6 database and redis 3.2.6 database cluster. Create and apply a module to a mysql database ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #. **Create the module file and trove module** When you create a database instance you can specify a module but first you must create it yourself and register it with the trove service. You can create a test module and mysql database with the module applied by doing the following. .. code-block:: console $ echo "message=Module.V1" > ping1.dat $ trove module-create mymod ping ping1.dat --live_update \ --datastore mysql +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | apply_order | 5 | | auto_apply | False | | created | 2017-06-02T17:06:21 | | datastore | all | | datastore_id | None | | datastore_version | all | | datastore_version_id | None | | description | None | | id | 0065a8ed-0668-4db5-a4ad-d88d0a166388 | | instance_count | 2 | | is_admin | True | | live_update | True | | md5 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | | name | mymod | | priority_apply | False | | tenant | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | tenant_id | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | type | ping | | updated | 2017-06-02T17:06:21 | | visible | True | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ $ trove create myinst 15 --size 1 --module mymod --datastore mysql +-------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | created | 2017-06-02T17:22:24 | | datastore | mysql | | datastore_version | 5.6 | | encrypted_rpc_messaging | True | | flavor | 15 | | id | 6221b30c-8292-4378-b624-c7e9b0f8ba9e | | name | myinst | | region | RegionOne | | server_id | None | | status | BUILD | | tenant_id | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | updated | 2017-06-02T17:22:24 | | volume | 1 | | volume_id | None | +-------------------------+--------------------------------------+ .. _show_and_list_modules: #. **Show and list modules** You can view the modules on your instance by doing the following. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-query myinst +-------+------+-----------+---------+--------+-----------+------------------------+------------------------+ | Name | Type | Datastore | Version | Status | Message | Created | Updated | +-------+------+-----------+---------+--------+-----------+------------------------+------------------------+ | mymod | ping | all | all | OK | Module.V1 | 2017-06-02 17:23:40.50 | 2017-06-02 17:23:40.50 | +-------+------+-----------+---------+--------+-----------+------------------------+------------------------+ You can also get a count of the instances each module is applied to by doing the following. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-instance-count mymod +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | True | 1 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ You can also list the instances that have a particular module applied by doing the following. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-instances mymod +--------------------------------------+--------+-----------+-------------------+--------+-----------+------+-----------+----------------------------------+ | ID | Name | Datastore | Datastore Version | Status | Flavor ID | Size | Region | Tenant ID | +--------------------------------------+--------+-----------+-------------------+--------+-----------+------+-----------+----------------------------------+ | 6221b30c-8292-4378-b624-c7e9b0f8ba9e | myinst | mysql | 5.6 | ACTIVE | 15 | 1 | RegionOne | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | +--------------------------------------+--------+-----------+-------------------+--------+-----------+------+-----------+----------------------------------+ Updating and creating a second module for a redis cluster ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To update a module you should have another file ready to update the module with: ..code-block:: console $ echo "message=Module.V2" > ping2.dat $ trove module-update mymod --file ping2.dat +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | apply_order | 5 | | auto_apply | False | | created | 2017-06-02T17:06:21 | | datastore | all | | datastore_id | None | | datastore_version | all | | datastore_version_id | None | | description | None | | id | 0065a8ed-0668-4db5-a4ad-d88d0a166388 | | is_admin | True | | live_update | True | | md5 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | | name | mymod | | priority_apply | False | | tenant | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | tenant_id | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | type | ping | | updated | 2017-06-02T17:56:12 | | visible | True | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ Now to show the usage with a redis cluster we can create it like so. ..code-block:: console $ trove cluster-create myclust redis 3.2.6 \ --instance=flavor=15,volume=1,module=mymod \ --instance=flavor=15,volume=1,module=mymod \ --instance=flavor=15,volume=1,module=mymod +-------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-------------------+--------------------------------------+ | created | 2017-06-02T18:00:17 | | datastore | redis | | datastore_version | 3.2.6 | | id | e4d91ca6-5980-430c-94d0-bf7abc63f712 | | instance_count | 3 | | name | myclust | | task_description | Building the initial cluster. | | task_name | BUILDING | | updated | 2017-06-02T18:00:17 | +-------------------+--------------------------------------+ The original 'count' command will still just show the first instance, unless --include_clustered is passed in. Here you can see the MD5 from each applied module, and you know that the single instance one is not 'current'. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-instance-count mymod +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | True | 3 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ Now if we update the module again we'll see all the instances are not 'current'. ..code-block:: console $ echo "message=Module.V3" > ping3.dat $ trove module-update mymod --file ping3.dat +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | apply_order | 5 | | auto_apply | False | | created | 2017-06-02T17:06:21 | | datastore | all | | datastore_id | None | | datastore_version | all | | datastore_version_id | None | | description | None | | id | 0065a8ed-0668-4db5-a4ad-d88d0a166388 | | is_admin | True | | live_update | True | | md5 | 869744bdd18e306a96c145df562065ab | | name | mymod | | priority_apply | False | | tenant | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | tenant_id | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | type | ping | | updated | 2017-06-02T18:06:53 | | visible | True | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | False | 3 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ To update an instance in a cluster you can use the :command:`trove module-apply` command ..code-block:: console $ trove cluster-instances myclust +--------------------------------------+------------------+-----------+------+--------+ | ID | Name | Flavor ID | Size | Status | +--------------------------------------+------------------+-----------+------+--------+ | 393462d5-906d-4214-af0d-538b7f618b2d | myclust-member-2 | 15 | 1 | ACTIVE | | a3fc5326-e1b6-456a-a8b1-08ad6bbb2278 | myclust-member-3 | 15 | 1 | ACTIVE | | cba31d4b-d038-42c2-ab03-56c6c176b49d | myclust-member-1 | 15 | 1 | ACTIVE | +--------------------------------------+------------------+-----------+------+--------+ $ trove module-apply 393462d5-906d-4214-af0d-538b7f618b2d mymod +-------+------+-----------+---------+--------+-----------+ | Name | Type | Datastore | Version | Status | Message | +-------+------+-----------+---------+--------+-----------+ | mymod | ping | all | all | OK | Module.V3 | +-------+------+-----------+---------+--------+-----------+ $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | False | 2 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:18:37 | 2017-06-02T18:18:37 | 869744bdd18e306a96c145df562065ab | True | 1 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ For completeness, we'll create one more instance and module: ..code-block:: console $ trove create myinst_2 15 --size 1 --module mymod +-------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | created | 2017-06-02T18:21:56 | | datastore | redis | | datastore_version | 3.2.6 | | encrypted_rpc_messaging | True | | flavor | 15 | | id | cdd85d94-13a0-4d90-89eb-9c05523d2ac6 | | name | myinst_2 | | region | RegionOne | | server_id | None | | status | BUILD | | tenant_id | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | updated | 2017-06-02T18:21:56 | | volume | 1 | | volume_id | None | +-------------------------+--------------------------------------+ $ echo "message=Module.V4" > ping4.dat $ trove module-update mymod --file ping4.dat +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | apply_order | 5 | | auto_apply | False | | created | 2017-06-02T17:06:21 | | datastore | all | | datastore_id | None | | datastore_version | all | | datastore_version_id | None | | description | None | | id | 0065a8ed-0668-4db5-a4ad-d88d0a166388 | | is_admin | True | | live_update | True | | md5 | 6e2c81c1547d640b4c6e7752ed0e33ab | | name | mymod | | priority_apply | False | | tenant | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | tenant_id | eac1e46e5f7840e39012aff46a92073a | | type | ping | | updated | 2017-06-02T18:26:22 | | visible | True | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ Now we have 2 single instances, and 3 cluster instances on various 'versions' of the module, none current. ..code-block:: console $ trove list +--------------------------------------+----------+-----------+-------------------+--------+-----------+------+-----------+ | ID | Name | Datastore | Datastore Version | Status | Flavor ID | Size | Region | +--------------------------------------+----------+-----------+-------------------+--------+-----------+------+-----------+ | 6221b30c-8292-4378-b624-c7e9b0f8ba9e | myinst | mysql | 5.6 | ACTIVE | 15 | 1 | RegionOne | | cdd85d94-13a0-4d90-89eb-9c05523d2ac6 | myinst_2 | redis | 3.2.6 | ACTIVE | 15 | 1 | RegionOne | +--------------------------------------+----------+-----------+-------------------+--------+-----------+------+-----------+ $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | False | 2 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:18:37 | 2017-06-02T18:21:57 | 869744bdd18e306a96c145df562065ab | False | 2 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ When we created the latest module, we did not use the --include_clustered flag so we will have to use the :command:`trove module-reapply` command. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-reapply mymod --md5=869744bdd18e306a96c145df562065ab --include_clustered $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | False | 2 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:38:48 | 2017-06-02T18:38:48 | 6e2c81c1547d640b4c6e7752ed0e33ab | True | 2 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ Now they're both updated. If we use the --force flag, we can reapply to already applied instances. Notice that the only thing that changes is the min and max updated date fields. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-reapply mymod --md5=6e2c81c1547d640b4c6e7752ed0e33ab --include_clustered --force $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 2017-06-02T17:22:25 | 7f700cc7b99606615f8b51946f6d3228 | False | 1 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | 2017-06-02T18:00:18 | ba7c204979c8de54be6efb70a17d40b9 | False | 2 | | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:40:45 | 2017-06-02T18:40:46 | 6e2c81c1547d640b4c6e7752ed0e33ab | True | 2 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ Now let's bring every instance to the current version. We'll use some of the optional arguments to control how many instances are updated at the same time. This is useful to avoid potential network issues, if the module payload is large. Since we aren't using the --force flag, the min updated date won't change. ..code-block:: console $ trove module-reapply mymod --include_clustered --batch_size=1 --delay=3 $ trove module-instance-count mymod --include_clustered +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | Module Name | Min Updated Date | Max Updated Date | Module MD5 | Current | Count | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+ | mymod | 2017-06-02T18:40:45 | 2017-06-02T18:44:10 | 6e2c81c1547d640b4c6e7752ed0e33ab | True | 5 | +-------------+---------------------+---------------------+----------------------------------+---------+-------+

commit_message:
Change all to baremetal on baremetal role

Pointing to all in the groups iteration causes deployment fail
when deployer node(localhost) does not have api_interface.

OpenStack nodes need api_interface by deployer not need api_interface
always that have connection by any interface to all nodes.

Change-Id: I33a1172a3e65a5f6a607c97bcd074d7221d5e9b4
Closes-Bug: #1686104

commit_message:
Modify an order between iptables and conntrack when update firewall

When update a firewall, we should update the iptables firstly,
and then remove the conntrack record, just like the function
create_firewall() and create_firewall_group(). Otherwise, the
contrack record could be reproduced. It will be occurred more
easily in scenario of large flow, because removing conntrack
and updating firewall will take some time, and in this interval
the subsequent flow could be came to reproduced the same
conntrack record.

Change-Id: I7bd36964199c6ce7c146f3ef06a693e9c6fe5353
Closes-bug: #1696093

commit_message:
Fix the disable expirer to remove crontab

Instead of doing this via puppet which has the consequence of including
the step_config and getting included on the host manifest. Lets disable
via ansible upgrade task instead.

Change-Id: I5f1a4019dd635dea67db4313bd06a228ae7bacd4

commit_message:
Workaround for limited disk space on undercloud

This setting make oooq delete all of the docker data after pushing the
images in the local registry.

Change-Id: I0e55d80c581f686888ba8b38deb830c1a818fe33
Related-Bug: #1694709
Depends-On: I0b69087b78dc974e6ffcb3674c88c435ec569988

added_lines: # Workaround for limited disk space on undercloud # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1694709 delete_docker_cache: true

commit_message:
Addition of firewall rules for Nuage

Added VxLAN and metadata agent firewall rules to neutron-compute-plugin
for Nuage. Removed a deprecated parameter 'OSControllerIp' as well.

Change-Id: If10c300db48c66b9ebeaf74b5f5fee9132e75366
(cherry picked from commit d5309c9443cbfe50ba5e7c15f025393a58b0804c)

commit_message:
Fix the remove mariadb volume failed

- when run tools/cleanup-containers mariadb, the mariadb volume remove
failed, because the "volumes_to_remove" can't catch the mariadb
volume, this patch to fix it.

- remove the unnecessary "()"

more test infomation, see http://paste.openstack.org/show/603359/

Closes-Bug: #1674207

Change-Id: I82f5922fcc84d222f74d2551a2c697bf78136a2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/59/447359/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Exclude containers for account quota

This commit adds the possibility to exclude certain containers
from the quota account mechanism. One use case for this feature
could be a scratch container, where a user can upload an unlimited
amount of data, which gets removed automatically after a certain time.

PUT and POST requests to containers which are excluded from the quota
mechanism just ignore the quota mechanism, and for requests to other
containers the total size of the excluded containers is substracted
from the total bytes used of the account.

Change-Id: I67c1d58a9ee2ce1744059b4cf08e0c797f1550f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/32/414232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: headers_to_account_info, headers_to_container_info, \ headers_to_object_info env['PATH_INFO'].startswith('/v1/a/exc'): cache_key = get_cache_key('a', env['PATH_INFO'].split('/')[-1]) hdrs = {'x-container-bytes-used': 1} env.setdefault('swift.infocache', {})[cache_key] = \ headers_to_container_info(hdrs, 200) start_response('200 OK', hdrs) elif env['REQUEST_METHOD'] == "HEAD" and \ def test_exclude_containers_success(self): headers = [('x-account-bytes-used', '1002'), ('x-account-meta-quota-bytes', '1000'), ('x-account-meta-quota-exclude-containers', 'exc1/exc2')] app = account_quotas.AccountQuotaMiddleware(FakeApp(headers)) cache = FakeCache(None) req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o', method='PUT', environ={'swift.cache': cache}) res = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) def test_exclude_containers_exceed_quota(self): headers = [('x-account-bytes-used', '1002'), ('x-account-meta-quota-bytes', '1000'), ('x-account-meta-quota-exclude-containers', 'exc1')] app = account_quotas.AccountQuotaMiddleware(FakeApp(headers)) cache = FakeCache(None) req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o', method='PUT', environ={'swift.cache': cache}) res = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 413) def test_exclude_containers_inside_exclude_container(self): headers = [('x-account-bytes-used', '1000'), ('x-account-meta-quota-bytes', '0'), ('x-account-meta-quota-exclude-containers', 'exc1')] app = account_quotas.AccountQuotaMiddleware(FakeApp(headers)) cache = FakeCache(None) req = Request.blank('/v1/a/exc1/o', method='PUT', environ={'swift.cache': cache}) res = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200)

commit_message:
Add bindep environment to tox

This is helpful for listing any missing system requirements [1].

This patch is initially adding libssl dev files to fix our gate.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

Closes-Bug: #1696713
Change-Id: I37d018b13cbf4bacf23e6605e7d313b1b1676e5c

We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files. deps = bindep commands = bindep test

that would do best-effort for a user to create a vendor profile doc if

commit_message:
WIP: Straw man for new format for vendor data

Based on learning so far, introduce a new clearer version of the vendor
profile doc.

The goal would be that a vendor would publish this document in a
canonical public location. We'll also make a tool that would make it
easy for a vendor to have a template with just the choices they've made
and the tool would crawl the discovery urls for them. Also, a tool
that would do best-effort for a user to create a vendor profile doc if
their vendor does not have one.

This introduces a version to the document. We'll update occ to add a
version to the current ones but default to 1.0 if no version is given.
There is no intent to drop suport for 1.0, but the reading of 1.0 should
internally become translation into the new form.

This includes copies of all of the version discovery docs. The reason
for that is that those typically change very infrequently and take quite
a few API calls to collect- especially given that they are not linked to
directly. A release valve is there for clouds that _do_ expect
those documents to change more frequently than updating their profile
document would allow, or for clouds wanting to do staged-rollouts of
services and thus want users to hit the keystone catalog every time.

This is in yaml form for ease of reading, but like the current vendor
data I expect we'll land it in json format for ease of consumption by
all tools.

Change-Id: Ic1b5f16dcc38d80aec17ccf8d78482532a3695ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/74/455774/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: profile: # Version of the schema for this profile document, not of the document itself version: 2.0 # Information about authenticating to the cloud auth: # keystone auth_url. can contain {region_name} as a substitution variable # to support clouds that do independent keystones per-region url: https://identity.example.com # list of auth plugins supported plugins: - password - token # Default plugin that users should use if they have no other specific # reasons to behave differently. defaults to password default_plugin: password # If the default plugin is not an in-tree plugin, a human browsable URL # where it can be fetched plugin_location: null choices: # enum - choices "global" or "regional". Defaults to global auth_url: global network: # List of available well-known networking architectures available # The values are: # v4-public - a user can boot a machine directly on a public network # v4-private - a user can create private networks # v4-nat - a user can create floating IPs # v6-public - a user can boot a machine with an IPv6 address # split-stack - a user is given a network that provides private v4 and # public v6 by default # Defaults to [v4-public, v4-private, v4-nat, v6-public] architectures: - v4-public - v6-public # A fnmatch pattern indicating the v4 public network by name # defaults to null. public_network_pattern: '*WAN*' # URL to web console for the cloud web_console: https://console.example.com # If the main web console is not horizon but a horizon is available, # its URL. Defaults to null horizon_console: https://horizon.example.com image: # list of formats in which an image can be for upload. defaults to qcow2 formats: - qcow2 - raw # format the cloud prefers, in case more than one is accepted. defaults # to qcow2 preferred_format: - qcow2 # enum of "true, false, provisional". If the value is provisional, # provisional_url must be provided which is a link to documentation of # how a user can request image upload be enabled. Defaults to true upload_enabled: true # URL describing how to request image upload capability be enabled. # Defaults to null provisional_url: null # List of upload mechanisms. Vaules are: # v1-put - upload via v1 REST PUT API # v2-put - upload via plain old v2 REST PUT API # task - upload via upload to swift and then v2 task-import API # upload - upload by new v2 image upload API # Defaults to [v1-put, v2-put] upload_mechanisms: - v1-put - v2-put compute: # Whether the cloud provides DHCP to guests has_dhcp: True # By default server snapshots are not live - they shut down the server # in question first. If the cloud operator has a new enough libvirt and # they have enabled it in the nova config, snapshots become live. has_live_snapshots: False # List of regions available in the cloud regions: - name: Dallas # Whether the region is enabled for everyone, must be requested or is # disabled. Values are true, false provisional. If the value is # provisional, provisional_url must be provided. Defaults to true enabled: true # URL describing how to request this region be enabled. Defaults to null provisional_url: null # List of Service dicts, each with a key name based on the key from # service-types-registry services: {} - name: compute # Discovery URL for service for the Public Endpoint of the service # A special value of "catalog" indicates that the user should not # rely on the data in this file and should instead perform discovery # starting from the keystone catalog. (Useful for large/complex # deployments where a new version of a service might be rolled out to # new users in batches) url: https://compute.example.com # Whether the service is enabled for everyone, must be requested or is # disabled. Values are true, false provisional. If the value is # provisional, provisional_url must be provided. Defaults to true enabled: true # URL describing how to request this service be enabled. provisional_url: null # Cached copy of the content of the discovery URL aligned to the API-WG # spec versions: - status: CURRENT max_version: 2.38 min_version: 2.1 id: v2.1 links: - href: http://compute.example.com/v2.1 rel: self - status: SUPPORTED id: v2.0 links: - href: http://compute.example.com/v2 rel: self

commit_message:
Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings

If the ring has been rebalanced recently, the next call to rebalance
will not rebalance again if the time passed is shorter than
min_part_time. swift-ring-builder returns an exit code of 1 in this
case, which is a warning, but not a hard error (errors will use an exit
code of 2).

It makes sense therefore to expect an exit code of 0 or 1 and only fail
if it's different.

Closes-Bug: 1677588
Change-Id: I03dd075c590344a920099c57b6a7530f103e0ede

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I9b23a0dfadaa195bc22ee7f8b8da0c0c9a0e6052
Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
Fix swift auth_url/url check

"backup_swift_url" and "backup_swift_auth_url" config options
are used for different modes. The first one is used when
backup_swift_auth=per_user, and the second one is used when
backup_swift_auth=single_user.

So they should not be checked in both modes. We should separate
them to avoid some unexpected error.

Change-Id: I278f07f4df553db1063d79bc5575ed1b30e503b1
Closes-bug: #1690281

commit_message:
Add polkit rule to allow kolla nova user access to libvirtd socket on docker host

The polkit rules are currently evaluated in the context of the docker host.
As a result the check fails for the kolla nova compute user, as the uids are not
consistent with the host uids (in fact we probably can't assume a nova user exists
on the docker host).

As a short-term workaround a 'docker_nova' user group is created on the docker host
and the polkit rule is updated to grant this user access to the libvirtd socket.

Longer term solution probably requires running polkitd in a container too.

Change-Id: I91be1f1eacf8eed9017bbfef393ee2d66771e8d6
Related-bug: #1693844

added_lines: # [*configure_libvirt_polkit*] # Configures libvirt polkit to grant the kolla nova user access to the libvirtd unix domain socket on the host. # Defaults to the libvirt_enabled value from the nova base profile. # # [*docker_nova_uid*] # When configure_libvirt_polkit = true, the uid/gid of the nova user within the docker container. # Defaults to 42436 # $configure_libvirt_polkit = hiera('tripleo::profile::base::nova::libvirt_enabled', false), $docker_nova_uid = 42436 if ($step >= 4 and $configure_libvirt_polkit) { # Workaround for polkit authorization for libvirtd socket on host # # This creates a local user with the kolla nova uid, and sets the polkit rule to # allow both it and the nova user from the nova rpms, should it exist (uid 162). group { 'docker_nova_group': name => 'docker_nova', gid => $docker_nova_uid } -> user { 'docker_nova_user': name => 'docker_nova', uid => $docker_nova_uid, gid => $docker_nova_uid, shell => '/sbin/nologin', comment => 'OpenStack Nova Daemons', groups => ['qemu','nobody'] } # Similar to the polkit rule in the openstack-nova rpm spec # but allow both the 'docker_nova' and 'nova' user $docker_nova_polkit_rule = '// openstack-nova libvirt management permissions polkit.addRule(function(action, subject) { if (action.id == "org.libvirt.unix.manage" && /^(docker_)?nova$/.test(subject.user)) { return polkit.Result.YES; } }); ' package {'polkit': ensure => installed, } -> file {'/etc/polkit-1/rules.d/50-nova.rules': content => $docker_nova_polkit_rule, mode => '0644' } }

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/98/464598/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Summary of the feature set. # Deploy an non-ha Openstack environment, without SSL, introspect, and # ready to execute tempest tests. # Example of usage: # ./quickstart.sh -t all --retain-inventory -e \ # @config/general_config/featureset012.yml -R tripleo-ci/consistent-master \ # -T all $VIRTHOST # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: true ssl_overcloud: false overcloud_templates_path: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates step_introspect: true # Tell tripleo about our environment enable_pacemaker: false network_isolation: false # Network settings float_base: "192.168.24" floating_ip_cidr: 10.0.0.0/24 public_net_pool_start: 10.0.0.150 public_net_pool_end: 10.0.0.250 public_net_gateway: 10.0.0.1 step_adjust_mtu: true mtu: 1350 mtu_interface: - eth0 - eth1 overcloud_dns_servers: - 10.1.8.10 - 8.8.8.8 - 8.8.4.4 extra_args: >- --ntp-server pool.ntp.org overcloud_nodes_count: 3 # Tempest run_tempest: true tempest_config: true test_regex: '.*' test_ping: false # keep the doc gen settings at the bottom of the config file. # options below direct automatic doc generation by tripleo-collect-logs artcl_gen_docs: true artcl_create_docs_payload: included_deployment_scripts: - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate included_static_docs: - env-setup-virt table_of_contents: - env-setup-virt - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq driver with blocking executor

We recently move ack/requeue of messages in main/polling thread
of rabbitmq drivers. And break the blocking executor.

This one is not tested by any tests and now deprecated.

This change workaround the issue until we completely remove the
blocking executor.

Change-Id: I445ca6ec7c79d9ab59610c94aa675d3da0daa37f
Closes-bug: #1694728
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/33/472233/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # HACK(sileht): We temporary pass the executor to the rabbit # listener to fix a race with the deprecated blocking executor. # We do this hack because this is need only for 'synchronous' # executor like blocking. And this one is deprecated. Making # driver working in an sync and an async way is complicated # and blocking have 0% tests coverage. if hasattr(self.listener, '_poll_style_listener'): l = self.listener._poll_style_listener if hasattr(l, "_message_operations_handler"): l._message_operations_handler._executor = ( self.executor_type)

commit_message:
Release notes for Pike-2

There are many other features added which demands a bump of API
micro-version to 1.7. We are not there yet, so we are not listing
them in this release.

Change-Id: I42667adf29bd302619296d712d1688587b060723

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixed an error in the built-in load-balancing policy that caused by regression in getting node details for IP addresses.

subject: Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 14:36:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch/commit/5b2942ad1703b3affacd4d930e70061bcc1c334f', 'message': "Remove untagged port from vlan prior to adding to other vlan in Brocade ICX

Brocade ICX (FastIron) require to remove port from vlan prior to adding it to
other vlan. Random failures may leave port in some vlan, and normal workflow
wouldn't be able to fix this (On most network devices it will, but not on ICX).

See detailed explanation in bugreport.

I added `return output` to send_commands_to_device() function.
It should be completely safe as previous implementation has no return at all
and newly returned value will be ignored everywhere in existing the code.

Change-Id: Id1513fc82d31a31b7d4a43fc305c678d17fd42b0
Closes-Bug: 1696409
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-07 14:38:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch/commit/167f5be413a429951168817ba52b6e671dd3f133', 'message': "Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add

Brocade ICX (FastIron) require to remove port from vlan prior to adding it to
other vlan. Random failures may leave port in some vlan, and normal workflow
wouldn't be able to fix this (On most network devices it will, but not on ICX).

See detailed explanation in bugreport.

I added `return output` to send_commands_to_device() function.
It should be completely safe as previous implementation has no return at all
and newly returned value will be ignored everywhere in existing the code.

Change-Id: Id1513fc82d31a31b7d4a43fc305c678d17fd42b0
Closes-Bug: 1696409
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-07 14:38:53.000000000', 'files': ['networking_generic_switch/tests/unit/netmiko/test_brocade_fastiron.py', 'networking_generic_switch/devices/netmiko_devices/brocade.py', 'networking_generic_switch/devices/netmiko_devices/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch/commit/97c9118a929d36e2ca6f9cba3c01f7d5de24dbda', 'message': "Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add

Brocade ICX (FastIron) require to remove port from vlan prior to
adding it to other vlan. Random failures may leave port in some
vlan, and normal workflow wouldn't be able to fix this
(On most network switches it will, but not on ICX).

See detailed explanation in bugreport.

I added `return output` to send_commands_to_device() function.
It should be completely safe as previous implementation has no

commit_message:
Brocade ICX driver: remove port from vlan prior to add

Brocade ICX (FastIron) require to remove port from vlan prior to
adding it to other vlan. Random failures may leave port in some
vlan, and normal workflow wouldn't be able to fix this
(On most network switches it will, but not on ICX).

See detailed explanation in bugreport.

I added `return output` to send_commands_to_device() function.
It should be completely safe as previous implementation has no
return at all and newly returned value will be ignored everywhere
in existing the code.

Change-Id: Id1513fc82d31a31b7d4a43fc305c678d17fd42b0
Closes-Bug: 1696409

commit_message:
Fix inventory without existing stack

The inventory currently tries to fetch stack outputs without checking if
the stack exists, so the inventory breaks if the plan has no
corresponding stack.

This patch changes the StackOutputs class to hide heat API exceptions
and return an empty output list instead.

Change-Id: Icb9e6828aeb1f65d8707333fc1098942f1691204
Closes-Bug: #1694712

commit_message:
[doc] Fix incorrect formatting on get alarm count

The spec for Get Alarm Count was appearing literally as:

  ##Get Alarm Counts Get the number of alarms that match the criteria.

  ###GET /v2.0/alarms/count
  etc.

It is now formatted so that the headings are rendered like corresponding entries.

Change-Id: Ic8ddc1fc3f56c00f22e8c0132a49be2cc7cd2fc1
Closes-Bug: #1696393

commit_message:
Deprecate property 'metadata' of OS::Heat::DeployedServer

The property 'metadata' doesn't make sense for resource
OS::Heat::DeployedServer, because the deployed server can
be provisioned out of nova. The deployment metadata
we can set by resource.metadata, so deprecate the
property 'metadata' and ignore it.

Change-Id: Id218d699a0d49f127243ec537f719dd247197279
Closes-Bug: #1693661

commit_message:
Raise better exception for Spark master validation

Previously RequiredServiceMissingException was raised for
all cases of invalid count for Spark master, even if the
service was present but count was otherwise incorrect. Now
the correct exception will be raised depending on whether
master is missing or master has wrong count.

Also, add missing unit tests for validation.

Change-Id: Ide7cc8414086e377c86306630920a3c753811458

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default
value to True in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0. Remove the
usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'
argument is deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default value to True
and then will be removed completely."

Change-Id: I10d550c5346e0935ee1ae3981d6ba41167577e20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/40/469440/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove **kwargs passing in payload __init__

The **kwargs was used in the payload class ctor to pass the payload
fields initialization up to the ovo base class. This is unnecessary
and confusing.

This patch replaces the **kwargs passing with direct field initialization
to make the payload construction more explicit.

Change-Id: I7770f6550fa40c1d9b0417efa57f58fa9c998d45
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-pike
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change to share access list API

When we do manila access-list, the 'created_at' and 'updated_at' time
should be shown to the user. And then the user could determine which
is the recent access rule. As designed, the recent access-allow
rule caused the error access-status of share instance.
The API change [1] has been merged.

[1] Iad6070d60ec77b7de9cc9679cfa7478876084da1

Change-Id: I4b10faa18a5e4d7394083cd36851fd0260df86a2
Closes-Bug: #1682795

Support object_type 'qos_policy' for neutron rbac

Support the new object_type 'qos_policy' for
neutron rbac.

Closes-Bug: #1689544
Change-Id: Ia818890862259fb6702feffa12273f6f9ee90ea8

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 3 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]
3. It makes the code look much better.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: Ia3e792c512da46c2b92d3ad9ec1657849d379052

commit_message:
Remove useless API tests

The 'test_flavor_swap' tests are validating behavior that's already
validated by the larger 'test_flavors' tests and a plethora of
functional tests. This is legacy from the time where exposing 'swap' was
required the 'os-flavor-swap' extension [1]. This extension was not
ported to v2.1 [2] and 'swap' is now part of the default response.

Stop special casing these particular fields.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/81dd5b78
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/a31d917a

Change-Id: I55a57b76a92677fbe7db9b6ef91f8cd4daf30d87

commit_message:
Add directory for Queens spec

We reached Cinder Spec Freeze [1] for Pike, so all specs should be
proposed to the next release.

[1]
https://releases.openstack.org/pike/schedule.html#p-cinder-spec-freeze

Change-Id: I308479d5d34edc01d2c6571883a5cae5f10b5c30

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent hostnames

This change ensures that the hostname is used consistently throughout
the Hyper-V driver.

This fixes a VM port binding issue in case of failovers.

Change-Id: Ic1c9644721dad451fb68131bdc5f9b3397d5e267
Closes-Bug: #1694238

commit_message:
Switch to Cryptography over pycrypto

The keystonemiddleware library recently switched to using the
cryptography library over pycrypto, which was unmaintained. See
Iced7f5115e49ccf4f7f5bf6813cb5988b95c248b

Change-Id: I1873e1f0bba1433ead11532c395c1e0f31ba3723
Co-Authored-By: Nolan Brubaker <nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-03 21:55:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ec8808b6edcfde3d7557f6dd31251cfb49cf040f', 'message': "placement: use separate tables for projects/users

We were a bit naughty in Iecbe0eb5717afb0b13ca90d4868a3ca5f9e8902b in
that we didn't normalize the storage of Keystone project and user
identifiers in the API DB's new consumers table. This means that we
will use a whole lot more storage for what ends up being very
repetitive data.

This patch changes the consumers DB table schema's project_id and
user_id columns from VARCHAR(255) to INT data type. This should result
in significantly faster queries for usage information since 9X the
index records can fit into a single index block in memory (36-byte
UUIDs stored in VARCHAR(255) versus 4-byte integers. The more index
records we can fit into a single page of memory, the faster both scans
and seeks will be.

Let's address this now before anything uses the consumers table.

Change-Id: I1b7357739f2a7e55c55d3acb9bd604731c4a2b32

commit_message:
placement: use separate tables for projects/users

We were a bit naughty in Iecbe0eb5717afb0b13ca90d4868a3ca5f9e8902b in
that we didn't normalize the storage of Keystone project and user
identifiers in the API DB's new consumers table. This means that we
will use a whole lot more storage for what ends up being very
repetitive data.

This patch changes the consumers DB table schema's project_id and
user_id columns from VARCHAR(255) to INT data type. This should result
in significantly faster queries for usage information since 9X the
index records can fit into a single index block in memory (36-byte
UUIDs stored in VARCHAR(255) versus 4-byte integers. The more index
records we can fit into a single page of memory, the faster both scans
and seeks will be.

Let's address this now before anything uses the consumers table.

Change-Id: I1b7357739f2a7e55c55d3acb9bd604731c4a2b32
blueprint: placement-project-user

commit_message:
add using cache to metadata

if  configured adds the resulting metadata tree to the cache and
upon next request retrieves the data from the cache
reduces the time of the second and subsequent sequential requests
to the metadata approximately from 2.5 seconds to 0.1

Change-Id: Ia1408f6ef407eb97db1789b5b60d6b36b162ba4d

commit_message:
[Share Groups] Squash SGS member and SS instances DB tables

Because the former was implemented just because the latter
was absent yet at that moment. Main reason is that they serve
same goals and should be consistent to each other. And it is
much easier to support one single table instead of two separate
tables syncing them each time we update one of them.

Change-Id: I81ba26437554d02a79e4b536d781617f46ce2f07
Partially-Implements bp manila-share-groups

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """This DB migration does following: Adds 'share_group_snapshot_member_export_locations' table. Updates 'share_group_snapshot_members' table the way it complies with 'share_snapshot_instances' one in various features support such as - export locations - reference to source share instance - required fields are not nullable anymore Revision ID: 95e12da10468 Revises: d5db24264f5c Create Date: 2017-02-13 17:37:17.024452 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '95e12da10468' down_revision = 'd5db24264f5c' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa from manila.db.migrations import utils SGSMEL_TABLE = 'share_group_snapshot_member_export_locations' SGSM_TABLE = 'share_group_snapshot_members' COLUMNS_TO_BE_UPDATED = ('share_instance_id', 'share_group_snapshot_id') def upgrade(): connection = op.get_bind() sgsm_table = utils.load_table(SGSM_TABLE, connection) # Update 'share_group_snapshot_id' and 'share_instance_id' attrs # adding value if absent and making it not nullable. for column_name in COLUMNS_TO_BE_UPDATED: op.execute( sgsm_table.update().where( getattr(sgsm_table.c, column_name) is None, ).values({ column_name: 'ERROR_was_not_set_before_DB_migration', })) op.alter_column( SGSM_TABLE, column_name, existing_type=sa.String(36), nullable=False) # Create table with export locations for share group snapshot members op.create_table( SGSMEL_TABLE, sa.Column('created_at', sa.DateTime), sa.Column('updated_at', sa.DateTime), sa.Column('deleted_at', sa.DateTime), sa.Column('id', sa.String(36), primary_key=True), sa.Column( 'share_group_snapshot_member_id', sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('%s.id' % SGSM_TABLE, name='sgsmel_sgsm_fk'), nullable=False, ), sa.Column('path', sa.String(2000)), sa.Column('is_admin_only', sa.Boolean, default=False, nullable=False), sa.Column('deleted', sa.String(36), default='False'), ) def downgrade(): op.drop_table(SGSMEL_TABLE) for column_name in COLUMNS_TO_BE_UPDATED: op.alter_column( SGSM_TABLE, column_name, existing_type=sa.String(36), nullable=True)

commit_message:
Switch to Cryptography over pycrypto

The keystonemiddleware library recently switched to using the
cryptography library over pycrypto, which was unmaintained. See
Iced7f5115e49ccf4f7f5bf6813cb5988b95c248b

Change-Id: Ic349904fc939a6132ed9b06882435686a148e00f
Co-Authored-By: Nolan Brubaker <nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com>

Deprecate rpc_backend option

(Replaced by [DEFAULT]/transport_url). Its value may be silently
ignored in the future.

commit_message:
Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

Closes-Bug: #1693692

Change-Id: Iee93ccdcc4ad0b1a41e6550c125f9474e0c8270f
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/82/472182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
OSC support service api

This patch adds osc client support for service api(including list,
delete, enable, disable and forcedown).

commit_message:
[cli-ref] Update python-novaclient to 9.0.0

Change-Id: Ib34fcc1256557cf51bd0c877716b1abbb68f75d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/03/472003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`nova` version ``9.0.0``. **DEPRECATED** Add new IP address on a network to server. **DEPRECATED** Update the VPN IP/port of a cloudpipe instance. **DEPRECATED** Create a cloudpipe instance for the given project. **DEPRECATED** Print a list of all cloudpipe instances. **DEPRECATED** Associate a floating IP address to a server. **DEPRECATED** Disassociate a floating IP address from a server. **DEPRECATED** Perform a power action on a host. **DEPRECATED** Describe a specific host. **DEPRECATED** List all hosts by service. **DEPRECATED** Update host settings. List servers. **DEPRECATED** Remove an IP address from a server. **DEPRECATED** Show virtual interface info about the given server. Update the attachment on the server. Migrates the data from an attached volume to the specified available volume and swaps out the active attachment to the new volume. **DEPRECATED** Create x509 cert for a user in tenant. **DEPRECATED** Fetch the x509 root cert. New name for aggregate. New availability zone for aggregate. (e.g. vda, xda, ...; if omitted, hypervisor driver chooses suitable device depending on selected bus; note the libvirt driver always uses default device names), size=size of the block device in MB(for swap) and in GB(for other formats) (if omitted, hypervisor driver to 0, for others need to be specified), remove) and tag=device metadata tag (optional). (Supported by API versions '2.42' - '2.latest') versions '2.42' - '2.latest') usage: nova flavor-access-list [--flavor <flavor>]List servers. usage: nova migration-list [--instance-uuid <instance_uuid>] [--host <host>] [--status <status>]``--instance-uuid <instance_uuid>`` Fetch migrations for the given instance. usage: nova volume-update <server> <src_volid> <dest_volid> Update the attachment on the server. Migrates the data from an attached volume to the specified available volume and swaps out the active attachment to the new volume.``<src_volid>`` ID of the source (original) volume. ``<dest_volid>`` ID of the destination volume.
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`nova` version ``8.0.0``. Add new IP address on a network to server. Update the VPN IP/port of a cloudpipe instance. Create a cloudpipe instance for the given project. Print a list of all cloudpipe instances. Associate a floating IP address to a server. Disassociate a floating IP address from a server. Perform a power action on a host. Describe a specific host. List all hosts by service. Update host settings. List active servers. Remove an IP address from a server. Show virtual interface info about the given server. Update volume attachment. Create x509 cert for a user in tenant. Fetch the x509 root cert... _nova_add-fixed-ip: nova add-fixed-ip ----------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova add-fixed-ip <server> <network-id> Add new IP address on a network to server. **Positional arguments:** ``<server>`` Name or ID of server. ``<network-id>`` Network ID. Name of aggregate. The availability zone of the aggregate. (e.g. vda, xda, ...; tag=device metadata tag (optional) if omitted, hypervisor driver chooses suitable device depending on selected bus; note the libvirt driver always uses default device names), size=size of the block device in MB(for swap) and in GB(for other formats) (if omitted, hypervisor driver to 0, for others need to be specified) and remove). (Supported by API versions '2.32' -'2.latest') versions '2.37' - '2.latest').. _nova_cloudpipe-configure: nova cloudpipe-configure ------------------------ .. code-block:: console usage: nova cloudpipe-configure <ip address> <port> Update the VPN IP/port of a cloudpipe instance. **Positional arguments:** ``<ip address>`` New IP Address. ``<port>`` New Port. .. _nova_cloudpipe-create: nova cloudpipe-create --------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova cloudpipe-create <project_id> Create a cloudpipe instance for the given project. **Positional arguments:** ``<project_id>`` UUID of the project to create the cloudpipe for. .. _nova_cloudpipe-list: nova cloudpipe-list ------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova cloudpipe-list Print a list of all cloudpipe instances. usage: nova flavor-access-list [--flavor <flavor>] [--tenant <tenant_id>]``--tenant <tenant_id>`` Filter results by tenant ID. (Deprecated; this option is not supported, and will be removed in version 5.0.0.) .. _nova_floating-ip-associate: nova floating-ip-associate -------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova floating-ip-associate [--fixed-address <fixed_address>] <server> <address> Associate a floating IP address to a server. **Positional arguments:** ``<server>`` Name or ID of server. ``<address>`` IP Address. **Optional arguments:** ``--fixed-address <fixed_address>`` Fixed IP Address to associate with. .. _nova_floating-ip-disassociate: nova floating-ip-disassociate ----------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova floating-ip-disassociate <server> <address> Disassociate a floating IP address from a server. **Positional arguments:** ``<server>`` Name or ID of server. ``<address>`` IP Address. .. _nova_host-action: nova host-action ---------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova host-action [--action <action>] <hostname> Perform a power action on a host. **Positional arguments:** ``<hostname>`` Name of host. **Optional arguments:** ``--action <action>`` A power action: startup, reboot, or shutdown. .. _nova_host-describe: nova host-describe ------------------ .. code-block:: console usage: nova host-describe <hostname> Describe a specific host. **Positional arguments:** ``<hostname>`` Name of host. .. _nova_host-list: nova host-list -------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova host-list [--zone <zone>] List all hosts by service. **Optional arguments:** ``--zone <zone>`` Filters the list, returning only those hosts in the availability zone <zone>. .. _nova_host-update: nova host-update ---------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova host-update [--status <enable|disable>] [--maintenance <enable|disable>] <hostname> Update host settings. **Positional arguments:** ``<hostname>`` Name of host. **Optional arguments:** ``--status <enable|disable>`` Either enable or disable a host. ``--maintenance <enable|disable>`` Either put or resume host to/from maintenance. List active servers. usage: nova migration-list [--host <host>] [--status <status>] [--cell_name <cell_name>]``--cell_name <cell_name>`` Fetch migrations for the given cell_name. (Deprecated; this option is not supported, and will be removed after version 8.0.0.) .. _nova_remove-fixed-ip: nova remove-fixed-ip -------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova remove-fixed-ip <server> <address> Remove an IP address from a server. **Positional arguments:** ``<server>`` Name or ID of server. ``<address>`` IP Address. .. _nova_virtual-interface-list: nova virtual-interface-list --------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova virtual-interface-list <server> Show virtual interface info about the given server. **Positional arguments:** ``<server>`` ID of server. usage: nova volume-update <server> <attachment> <volume> Update volume attachment.``<attachment>`` Attachment ID of the volume. ``<volume>`` ID of the volume to attach. .. _nova_x509-create-cert: nova x509-create-cert --------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova x509-create-cert [<private-key-filename>] [<x509-cert-filename>] Create x509 cert for a user in tenant. **Positional arguments:** ``<private-key-filename>`` Filename for the private key. [Default: pk.pem] ``<x509-cert-filename>`` Filename for the X.509 certificate. [Default: cert.pem] .. _nova_x509-get-root-cert: nova x509-get-root-cert ----------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: nova x509-get-root-cert [<filename>] Fetch the x509 root cert. **Positional arguments:** ``<filename>`` Filename to write the x509 root cert.

commit_message:
SUSE: Add the Cloud:OpenStack:Ocata repository

The OBS Cloud:OpenStack:Ocata repository contains most of the necessary
packages to deploy an OpenStack cloud so it's best to have it installed
as soon as possible.

Change-Id: I131558011d056da63f03a6e7d8276d93c594c9aa

commit_message:
Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

This patch is to enable the H106 and H203 checks in Zun project.

Change-Id: Ib15bf2af5daebb5cd4d36f36226d92874198296b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/40/471540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Api-ref: add documentation for 'os-volume_upload_image' action

There is no document about 'os-volume_upload_image' action. This action
uploads volume to Image Service as an image. So add the missing content.

Closes-bug: #1695796
Change-Id: I222e963239cbe0baff85135039ef55dab705bcea

commit_message:
Fixing spark and CDH refinements

Actually there is no much difference between using CDH 5.4 and 5.5
for spark, because both are using Hadoop 2.6 as a base.
Also removing redundant case in installing packages for CDH.

Change-Id: Ie24bb72365352edb22d94a461df0a0af6cd71806
Closes-bug: 1686400

added_lines: function add_repo_5_4_0 { case $DISTRO_NAME in ubuntu ) # Add repository with postgresql package (it's dependency of cloudera packages) # Base image doesn't contain this repo echo -e 'deb http://nova.clouds.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ precise universe multiverse main' >> /etc/apt/sources.list # Cloudera repositories echo 'deb [arch=amd64] http://archive.cloudera.com/cdh5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/cdh precise-cdh5.4.0 contrib' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cdh5.list echo 'deb-src http://archive.cloudera.com/cdh5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/cdh precise-cdh5.4.0 contrib' >> /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cdh5.list wget -qO - http://archive-primary.cloudera.com/cdh5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/cdh/archive.key | apt-key add - echo 'deb [arch=amd64] http://archive.cloudera.com/cm5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/cm precise-cm5.4.0 contrib' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cm5.list echo 'deb-src http://archive.cloudera.com/cm5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/cm precise-cm5.4.0 contrib' >> /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cm5.list wget -qO - http://archive-primary.cloudera.com/cm5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/cm/archive.key | apt-key add - wget -O /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kms.list http://archive.cloudera.com/navigator-keytrustee5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/navigator-keytrustee/cloudera.list wget -qO - http://archive.cloudera.com/navigator-keytrustee5/ubuntu/precise/amd64/navigator-keytrustee/archive.key | apt-key add - apt-get update ;; centos | rhel ) echo '[cloudera-cdh5]' > /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-cdh5.repo echo "name=Cloudera's Distribution for Hadoop, Version 5" >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-cdh5.repo echo 'baseurl=http://archive.cloudera.com/cdh5/redhat/6/x86_64/cdh/5.4.0/' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-cdh5.repo echo 'gpgkey = http://archive.cloudera.com/cdh5/redhat/6/x86_64/cdh/RPM-GPG-KEY-cloudera' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-cdh5.repo echo 'gpgcheck = 1' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-cdh5.repo echo '[cloudera-manager]' > /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-manager.repo echo 'name=Cloudera Manager' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-manager.repo echo 'baseurl=http://archive.cloudera.com/cm5/redhat/6/x86_64/cm/5.4.0/' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-manager.repo echo 'gpgkey = http://archive.cloudera.com/cm5/redhat/6/x86_64/cm/RPM-GPG-KEY-cloudera' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-manager.repo echo 'gpgcheck = 1' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudera-manager.repo wget -O /etc/yum.repos.d/kms.repo http://archive.cloudera.com/navigator-keytrustee5/redhat/6/x86_64/navigator-keytrustee/navigator-keytrustee5.repo yum clean all ;; esac } 5.4) echo "Installing CDH Version $DIB_CDH_VERSION..." add_repo_5_4_0 ;;

commit_message:
[TEST] Remove unnecessary meta-deps

The galera_client role implements the use of the
apt_package_pinning role in order to pin the
packages from MariaDB, but it already has the
apt_package_pinning role as a meta-dep for itself
so we don't need to carry it here.

The pip_install role is also a meta-dep for the
galera_client role, so there's no need to carry
it here.

With the galera_client role as a meta dependency,
it runs every time this role is executed, even
when using include_role with a subset of tasks.
We could instead run the galera_client role in
the playbook when the host is initially prepped.

Depends-On: I2661176611806b0b7abfc20bf2eb4828108b9eb2
Change-Id: Ie54edb54b94e8dd1afa50667e1206b1289f4c960

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary f.close()

Context manager will handle file closing automatically. So
it no need to use f.close().

Change-Id: Iaf809e3030c875a47876a373b76dae357fe85cc8

commit_message:
api-ref: Add tags to server(s) detail response

Server tags were added in 2.26 to the server (singular) details
response [1], and servers (plural) detail response[2]. They do not
appear in the api-ref. This patches adds them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/268932/32/doc/api_samples/os-server-tags/v2.26/server-tags-show-details-resp.json
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/268932/32/doc/api_samples/os-server-tags/v2.26/servers-tags-details-resp.json

Closes-bug: 1673628
Change-Id: Ib6aebb8d336b121888649a1cbfa1b8ac5e0e6e74

commit_message:
Remove unused migrate_data kwarg from virt driver destroy() method

The removed argument was not used, and it was removed from the base
driver, and the Hyper-V Driver has to respect the signature.

Change-Id: Ic13706408bf6955f56c3c9c4632a58d18fc871c2

commit_message:
Remove deprecated oslo_messaging.get_transport

DeprecationWarning:
Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport.

Replace get_transport with get_rpc_transport.

Change-Id: I18eddf2cb1ae7f50f2c5c9ccf30b87cadc34d3a3

commit_message:
[WIP] add containerized deployment on multinode

- override nonha-multinode to test containers-multinode
- add prep container role in multinode playbook
- added containers tag to multinode jobs
- removed leftover containers_minimal file from toci-quickstart/playbooks
dir

commit_message:
Trove fix backup restore with Swift

'v1' is missing in DEFAULT/swift_url property for trove.conf and
trove-taskmanager.conf file.

Closes-Bug: #1677362
Change-Id: I7f625b1ac665a26c4207c3cbb9b0238da82993d8
(cherry picked from commit b6ab5bf7e91b7b762e647745d99c19fdafc8d021)

subject: Transpose the featureset documentation table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-29 12:34:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/feature-configuration.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/1bb2afd44826002e545b0e5b18ff10a24126c9b1', 'message': "Transpose the featureset documentation table

The featureset table is growing too large as we add new featuresets, and
it's hard to solve conflicts.

By using featuresets on lines rather than columns, we can expand the
table more naturally, and the resolving conflicts will be much easier
since we can manipulate whole lines, and source code diffs work in a
line-based fashion.

Change-Id: I637da5d26a1242c194910d6b2938d731e264134b
"}]
commit_message:
Transpose the featureset documentation table

The featureset table is growing too large as we add new featuresets, and
it's hard to solve conflicts.

By using featuresets on lines rather than columns, we can expand the
table more naturally, and the resolving conflicts will be much easier
since we can manipulate whole lines, and source code diffs work in a
line-based fashion.

Change-Id: I637da5d26a1242c194910d6b2938d731e264134b
