commit_message:
Update code to React Router v4 API

* Move from route config to Route components in container components
* Reorganize Authentication functionality to use <Redirect> components
* Move Zaqar connection init from login actions to
  AuthenticatedContent component so history object can be passed to
  ZaqarActions
* Update Deployment Plan, Plans, Roles and Deployment Configuration
  routes
* Add checkRunningDeployment HOC to handle redirecting when Plan
  deployment is in progress

Change-Id: Iaa87a710e3ed57f7bbf41d948583fc5c0b777cec

subject: Optimise the distro package installation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-05 10:09:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/commit/974419e1693df475f72364a7e64bb64733ea27fb', 'message': 'Optimise the distro package installation

In order to optimise the distro package installation
process the list of packages to install is prepared
for the host, then installed by passing the package
task the full list instead of using a loop.

Change-Id: I8bae6b5a39f78a2ee4fb02e31d91c1dd3eca7cb0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-05 10:46:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/commit/7ff389ec3b5bfdb3c21a951f9a1222ab4700196e', 'message': 'Optimise the distro package installation

In order to optimise the distro package installation
process the list of packages to install is prepared
for the host, then installed by passing the package

commit_message:
Optimise the distro package installation

In order to optimise the distro package installation
process the list of packages to install is prepared
for the host, then installed by passing the package
task the full list instead of using a loop.

Change-Id: I8bae6b5a39f78a2ee4fb02e31d91c1dd3eca7cb0

commit_message:
Update openstack-on-lxd section

Use openstack client commands instead of nova and neutron.

Change-Id: Ib18b80640244f359e11495081e390b5d78eff419
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/81/470781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The tools in the openstack-on-lxd git repository require the use of Juju 2.x, which provides full support for the LXD local provider. The Ocata version of the OpenStack clients should be used with this procedure. These tools are provided as part of the Ubuntu Cloud Archive on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. sudo add-apt-repository cloud-archive:ocata -y && sudo apt update The latest Juju 2.x beta release can be obtained from the Juju team devel PPA:Review the contents of the config.yaml prior to running this command and edit as appropriate; this configures some defaults for containers created in the model including setting up things like APT proxy to improve performance of network operations. openstack floating ip create ext_net openstack server add floating ip <uuid-of-instance> <new-floating-ip> openstack security group rule create default --protocol icmp --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 --project admin openstack security group rule create default --protocol tcp --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 --dst-port 22 --project admin
deleted_lines: The tools in the openstack-on-lxd git repository require the use of Juju 2.x, which provides full support for the LXD local provider.These tools are provided as part of the Ubuntu 16.04 LTS release; the latest Juju 2.x beta release can be obtained from the Juju team devel PPA:Review the contents of the config.yaml prior to running this command and edit as appropriate; this configures some defaults for containers created in the model including setting up things like a APT proxy to improve performance of network operations. nova floating-ip-create nova add-floating-ip <uuid-of-instance> <new-floating-ip> neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol icmp \ --direction ingress $(nova secgroup-list | grep default | awk '{ print $2 }') neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol tcp \ --port-range-min 22 --port-range-max 22 \ --direction ingress $(nova secgroup-list | grep default | awk '{ print $2 }')

commit_message:
Simplify multi arch repo build

When using repo_build, we were creating groups by architecture,
but then did complex operations to see if they were using
different os versions.

This commit simplifies this, by creating groups depending on both
arch and distribution: It improves readability, but also
fixes the issues where no group was previously created for
multiple architectures.

Change-Id: I36c3033b8a932a81d98bd85d6cfb738e77147192
Closes-Bug: #1694265

To run it on each host we have to loop. name: "{{ item }}" groups: repo_masters when: - "inventory_hostname in groups['repo_servers_' + ansible_distribution_version + '_' + ansible_architecture][0]" with_inventory_hostnames: - repo_all tags: - always hosts: repo_masters

Also note, we have # to manually lookup the ansible_architecture for the 'item' host. name: "{{ groups['repo_servers_' + (hostvars[item].ansible_distribution_version.split('.')[:2] | join('.')) + hostvars[item].ansible_architecture][0] }}" groups: "repo_nodes" when: > hostvars[item].ansible_architecture != hostvars[groups['repo_all'][0]].ansible_architecture or (hostvars[item].ansible_distribution_version.split('.')[:2] | join('.')) != (hostvars[groups['repo_all'][0]].ansible_distribution_version.split('.')[:2] | join('.')) with_items: - "{{ groups['repo_all'][1:] }}" hosts: repo_nodes, repo_all[0]

commit_message:
Convert puppet and docker steps to ansible

Replace the multiple SoftwareDeployment resources with a common
playbook that runs on all roles, consuming the configuration data
written via the HostPrepAnsible tasks.

This hopefully simplifies things, and will enable re-running the
deploy steps for minor updates (we'll need some way to detect
a container should be replaced, but that will be done via a
follow-up patch).

Change-Id: I674a4d9d2c77d1f6fbdb0996f6c9321848e32662

commit_message:
Use get_rpc_transport instead of get_transport

With the added get_rpc_transport() function in oslo.messaging [1]
and the recent version bump of oslo.messaging to 5.24.2, we can
safely replace get_transport() with get_rpc_transport() which is much
cleaner.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454194/

Change-Id: Ib7e204a40e88aecfbd9b024feefdc7aa45e943e2

commit_message:
Build universal wheels

The trove metadata for this package claims to support both Python
2.x and Py3K; build universal wheels so Python 3.x interpreters can
consume them too.

Change-Id: I0b88fcaa2ea36e1d7478d76b86c6c1f1e68c8616

commit_message:
Set tempest image user var

If we don't use cirros image, ``image_ssh_user = cirros`` is wrong,
so we should make it be variable.

Change-Id: I0a1d6999d1dbc8ce319f4bd504455dfd1fb5fceb
Closes-Bug: #1696088

commit_message:
Add makestep in chrony.conf

Normally chronyd will cause the system to gradually correct any time offset, by slowing down or speeding up the clock as required.
In certain situations, the system clock might be so far adrift
that this slewing process would take a very long time to correct the system clock

Change-Id: I939b6aae1dbeb133203085ec68bdb9f7936ee9ef
Closes-Bug: #1696056

commit_message:
Add congress-dashboard to $PROJECTS variable in murano-congress-job

Now murano-cpngress-job gives the error:
The /opt/stack/new/congress-dashboard project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

So we need add congress-dashboard to $PROJECTS variable.

Change-Id: I9dd3937e50ac3430c4982914de5b157222c8a5cd

commit_message:
Add NovaServers.boot_and_evacuate_server

This scenario launches a VM on a compute node available in
the availability zone and then evacuates the VM to another
compute node on the same availability zone.

Change-Id: I729f7d4045c0a83ff433b21f818c01f406262897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/51/385351/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__find_host_to_evacuate(self): fake_server = self.server fake_host = {"nova-compute": {"available": True}} fake_host_compute_off = {"nova-compute": {"available": False}} fake_host_no_compute = {"nova-conductor": {"available": True}} self.admin_clients("nova").servers.get.return_value = fake_server self.admin_clients("nova").availability_zones.list.return_value = [ mock.MagicMock(zoneName="a", hosts={"a1": fake_host, "a2": fake_host, "a3": fake_host}), mock.MagicMock(zoneName="b", hosts={"b1": fake_host, "b2": fake_host, "b3": fake_host, "b4": fake_host_compute_off, "b5": fake_host_no_compute}), mock.MagicMock(zoneName="c", hosts={"c1": fake_host, "c2": fake_host, "c3": fake_host}) ] setattr(fake_server, "OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host", "b2") setattr(fake_server, "OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone", "b") nova_scenario = utils.NovaScenario(context=self.context) self.assertIn( nova_scenario._find_host_to_evacuate(fake_server), ["b1", "b3"]) def test__evacuate_server(self): fake_server = self.server fake_host = mock.MagicMock() self.admin_clients("nova").servers.get(return_value=fake_server) nova_scenario = utils.NovaScenario(context=self.context) nova_scenario._evacuate_server(fake_server, fake_host, on_shared_storage=None, password=None, skip_host_check=True) self.mock_wait_for.mock.assert_called_once_with( self.server, ready_statuses=["ACTIVE"], update_resource=self.mock_get_from_manager.mock.return_value, check_interval=CONF.benchmark.nova_server_evacuate_poll_interval, timeout=CONF.benchmark.nova_server_evacuate_timeout) self.mock_get_from_manager.mock.assert_called_once_with() self._test_atomic_action_timer(nova_scenario.atomic_actions(), "nova.evacuate_server") def test__force_down_service(self): nova_scenario = utils.NovaScenario() host = "foo_host" binary = "foo_binary" force_down = "foo_force_down" result = nova_scenario._force_down_service( host, binary, force_down=force_down) self.assertEqual( self.admin_clients("nova").services. force_down.return_value, result) self.admin_clients("nova").services.force_down.assert_called_once_with( host, binary, force_down=force_down) self._test_atomic_action_timer(nova_scenario.atomic_actions(), "nova.force_down_service")

commit_message:
Provide commands for example roles

In order to improve the experiance for the end user, we have existing
sets of roles that can be combined in a roles_data.yaml file for the
deployment. This change exposes the ability to generate roles_data.yaml
from a folder containing role yaml files rather than requiring the end
user manually construct the roles_data.yaml.

Change-Id: I326bae5bdee088e03aa89128d253612ef89e5c0c
Related-Blueprint: example-custom-role-environments

commit_message:
Fix styles for error page template

500.html template has incorrect styles for OpenStack logo. This patch
fixes margins and background image size to fit into the container.

Change-Id: Icc2af2731eb8a842c12c073474f3865709b6de2b
Closes-Bug: #1696437

commit_message:
contrail: add vrouter VIF plugin type support

The VIF plugin will provide support OpenContrail SDN Controller driver
in nova. It will initially be used for OpenContrail dpdk driver.
The plugin is located here:
https://github.com/Juniper/contrail-nova-vif-driver

Implements: blueprint opencontrail-nova-vif-plugin
Change-Id: Ic23effc05c901575f608f2b4c5ccd2b1fb3c2d5a

added_lines: elif vif['details'].get(model.VIF_DETAILS_VHOSTUSER_VROUTER_PLUG, False): vif_details = vif['details'] mode = vif_details.get(model.VIF_DETAILS_VHOSTUSER_MODE, 'server') sock_path = vif_details.get(model.VIF_DETAILS_VHOSTUSER_SOCKET) if sock_path is None: raise exception.VifDetailsMissingVhostuserSockPath( vif_id=vif['id']) obj = _get_vif_instance(vif, objects.vif.VIFVHostUser, mode=mode, path=sock_path, plugin="vrouter", vif_name=_get_vif_name(vif)) return obj

commit_message:
fix path for ldlinux.c32

This fixes the path for ldlinux.c32. It should be in the absolute
path /usr/..., not the relative path usr/...

Related-Bug: #1694394

This is a followup to ead3b90655979d0423f409b21a17da9e28a8de1b

commit_message:
Fix cell0 naming when QS params on the connection

We had a problem when the nova connection string included parameters on the
query string like charset encoding.
Note that the connection string necessarly needs to be RFC1738 compliant as
per Sqlalchemy rules, so it's totally safe to just unquote what the SQLA
helper method gives us as a result.

Also removed a tested connection string since it wasn't RFC1738 compatible.

Change-Id: I45fe9b92e8d93a0099d33bb0070e9d4e540595ac
Closes-Bug: #1696001

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I5f529e5f15341e28b257cd42766e66390469d3f6
Closes-Bug:#1693670

environment.

added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2017 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # require 'spec_helper' describe 'tripleo::profile::base::novajoin' do let :params do { :oslomsg_rpc_hosts => ['some.server.com'], :oslomsg_rpc_password => 'somepassword', :step => 5 } end shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::novajoin' do context 'with step less than 3' do before do params.merge!({ :step => 2 }) end it 'should not do anything' do is_expected.to_not contain_class('nova::metadata::novajoin::api') end end context 'with step 3' do before do params.merge!({ :step => 3 }) end it 'should provide basic initialization' do is_expected.to contain_class('nova::metadata::novajoin::api').with( :transport_url => 'rabbit://guest:somepassword@some.server.com:5672/?ssl=0' ) end end context 'with multiple hosts' do before do params.merge!({ :oslomsg_rpc_hosts => ['some.server.com', 'someother.server.com'] }) end it 'should construct a multihost URL' do is_expected.to contain_class('nova::metadata::novajoin::api').with( :transport_url => 'rabbit://guest:somepassword@some.server.com:5672,guest:somepassword@someother.server.com:5672/?ssl=0' ) end end context 'with username provided' do before do params.merge!({ :oslomsg_rpc_username => 'bunny' }) end it 'should construct URL with username' do is_expected.to contain_class('nova::metadata::novajoin::api').with( :transport_url => 'rabbit://bunny:somepassword@some.server.com:5672/?ssl=0' ) end end context 'with username and password provided' do before do params.merge!( { :oslomsg_rpc_username => 'bunny', :oslomsg_rpc_password => 'carrot' } ) end it 'should construct URL with username and password' do is_expected.to contain_class('nova::metadata::novajoin::api').with( :transport_url => 'rabbit://bunny:carrot@some.server.com:5672/?ssl=0' ) end end context 'with multiple hosts and user info provided' do before do params.merge!( { :oslomsg_rpc_hosts => ['some.server.com', 'someother.server.com'], :oslomsg_rpc_username => 'bunny', :oslomsg_rpc_password => 'carrot' } ) end it 'should distributed user info across hosts URL' do is_expected.to contain_class('nova::metadata::novajoin::api').with( :transport_url => 'rabbit://bunny:carrot@some.server.com:5672,bunny:carrot@someother.server.com:5672/?ssl=0' ) end end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) do facts.merge({}) end it_behaves_like 'tripleo::profile::base::novajoin' end end end

commit_message:
controller: Upd. remaining refs to generic vif

In 97ded78681060b6ca36c9d12ee81a8ba13c69ff9 we renamed
GenericPodVIFDriver to the more accurate NeutronPodVIFDriver.
Unfortunately we missed a few places. This patch solves that.

Change-Id: I441e7236f9e2bb1f64ad5ae5bcc43218adf5abb3
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: I532fe2537fcd2ae6b4344d214a308b1a26416745

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type' argument is deprecated
in version '4.0' and will be removed in version '5.0': The argument
enforce_type has changed its default value to True and then will
be removed completely."

Change-Id: I1043031efab084df3ac4ebfab5949a1ae6551d53

Remove cells topic configuration option

This has been deprecated since 15.0.0. It will now continue to use the
default value 'cells'.

commit_message:
Configure multi-queue value for DPDK Port

The multi-queue option for DPDK is applied via ovs-vsctl command
via ovs_extra params. This patch adds support for configuring the
rx_queue (multi-queue) value to the DPDK Ports.

Change-Id: Ib9faad5e9d49f78e3a0b45ef3ae0082f3e9d14a6
Co-Authored-By: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
implements: blueprint ovs-2-6-features-dpdk

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 21:56:47.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/1d2dfd6ec82d24ccb158410ca7d52f6758d3ab45', 'message': 'Revert "upgrade astroid to 1.5.3"

This change breaks the trove gate. It is apparent from the line being changed that this change should also address the pylint version.

This close to the release gate, do we really need to be messing with these kinds of things and breaking project gates?

Change-Id: Ie340d5bb326f8aa6e066b36179c76ef7df24119a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "upgrade astroid to 1.5.3"

This change breaks the trove gate. It is apparent from the line being changed that this change should also address the pylint version.

This close to the release gate, do we really need to be messing with these kinds of things and breaking project gates?

This reverts commit 99fae827973465147359cc7032c83003802612a7.

Change-Id: Ie340d5bb326f8aa6e066b36179c76ef7df24119a

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type' argument is deprecated
in version '4.0' and will be removed in version '5.0': The argument
enforce_type has changed its default value to True and then will
be removed completely."

Change-Id: Id4314bcb541c09c7dcec81b98ccd28078787f5c3

commit_message:
libvirt: set full description of the controller used by disk

Adds to LibvirtConfigGuestDisk the ability to handle object to provide
full description of the controller which should be used.

Closes-Bug: #1686116
Change-Id: Id796d9129ff850abd209f4e9e4e54ea77c477acf

added_lines: def test_config_disk_device_address_drive_added(self): obj = config.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk() obj.source_type = "file" obj.source_path = "/tmp/hello" obj.target_dev = "/dev/hda" obj.target_bus = "scsi" obj.device_addr = config.LibvirtConfigGuestDeviceAddressDrive() obj.device_addr.controller = 1 obj.device_addr.bus = 2 obj.device_addr.target = 3 obj.device_addr.unit = 4 self.assertXmlEqual(""" <disk type="file" device="disk"> <source file="/tmp/hello"/> <target bus="scsi" dev="/dev/hda"/> <address type="drive" controller="1" bus="2" target="3" unit="4"/> </disk>""", obj.to_xml())

Update installation guide

The link of Red Hat certificate system release notes is out of date, replace it with
the latest link. Also specify the absolute path of barbican.conf to follow the convention.

Change-Id: I94b636eb77cc5cac7df8f12c9917a3a1a48d3ee5

commit_message:
Remove translation of log messages

The i18n team has decided not to translate
the logs because it seems like it not very useful;
operators prefer to have them in English so that
they can search for those strings on the internet.

Closes-Bug: #1694193

Change-Id: I5b215eabd833c6e175168e7184944017815b0107

commit_message:
Replace oslo.messaging.get_transport with get_notification_transport

DeprecationWarning: Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport

Change-Id: I797683cca360ec36feaaf4ee83aa72527605a2ed

commit_message:
Remove support for py34
The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka.
This is due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial,
where only python3.5 is available.
There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I84552b20626af0474fa67d91124324e5bc9c775c

commit_message:
libvirt: rearange how scsi controller is defined

This commit make just cleaner how we configure the
scsi controller.

Closes-Bug: #1686116
Change-Id: I03b03962748db7081abd5aebf3578ddc4e30fe68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/459739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: scsi_controller = self._get_scsi_controller(image_meta) if scsi_controller: devices.append(scsi_controller) return devices @staticmethod def _get_scsi_controller(image_meta): """Return scsi controller or None based on image meta""" # TODO(sahid): should raise an exception for an invalid controller return scsi_controller

commit_message:
Update help text for all commands

Update help text to make commands easier to use
and more accurate.

Change-Id: I0ed5d4f8173661fd8e86eff6860e9a7605f67763
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-octaviaclient refs/changes/41/466441/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help="Load balncer to add the pool to (name or ID)." help="Set pool name." help="Set pool description." help="Set the pool protocol." help="Listener to add the pool to (name or ID)." help="Set the session persistence for the listener (key=value)." help="Load balancing algorithm to use." help="Set the project owning this pool (name or ID)." help="Enable pool (default)." help="Disable pool." help="Pool to delete (name or ID)." help="Pool to update (name or ID)." help="Set the name of the pool." help="Set the description of the pool." help="Set protocol for the pool." help="Load balncer to add the pool to (name or ID)." help="Listener to add the pool to (name or ID)." help="Set the session persistence for the listener (key=value)." help="Set the load balancing algorithm to use." help="Enable pool." help="Disable pool."
deleted_lines: help="Load balncer to add the pool to (name or ID)" help="Set pool name" help="Set pool description" help="Set the pool protocol" help="Listener to add to pool (name or ID)" help="Set the session persistence for the listener (key=value)" help="Load balancing algorithm to use" help="Set the ID of the project owning this pool" help="Enable pool (default)" help="Disable pool" help="Pool to delete (name or ID)" help="Pool to update (name or ID)" help="New pool name" help="Set pool description" help="Set protocol" help="Load balncer to add to pool (name or ID)" help="Listener to add to pool (name or ID)" help="Set the session persistence for the listener (key=value)" help="Load balancing algorithm to use" help="Enable pool (default)" help="Disable pool"

Add healthmonitor commands to client

This patch implements the the create,
delete, list, set, and show commands for
healthmonitors within the openstack client.

commit_message:
Prep for is_admin_project for scoped operations

Shift from controller.protected decorator to using
authorization.check_policy

Change-Id: I9f79f4312acefe058a97d421d59a840907a3321c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/11/471911/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.common import authorization def create_project(self, request, project): request.assert_authenticated() validation.lazy_validate(schema.project_create, project) try: domain_id = project['domain_id'] except KeyError: if not project.get('is_domain'): domain_id = request.context.domain_id if domain_id is None: domain_id = request.context.project_domain_id project['domain_id'] = domain_id ref = self._assign_unique_id(self._normalize_dict(project)) kwargs = {'project': ref} args = [self, request, ref] authorization.check_policy( self, request, 'create_project', filter_attr=None, input_attr=kwargs, target_attr=None, args=args, kwargs=kwargs)
deleted_lines: @controller.protected() def create_project(self, request, project): validation.lazy_validate(schema.project_create, project) ref = self._assign_unique_id(self._normalize_dict(project))

commit_message:
Filter services dictionary per host

To greatly reduce the amount of log noise from skipped tasks, set a
var in the role that filters the 'nova_services' dict to one that only
contains services relevant for each host.

Change-Id: I38ab4345f06ba6c9ef45cfe8e3ef48f2328b2333
(cherry picked from commit f2ed992208e4fdaa10a6c45a5797996d1ca20b51)

subject: Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-25 09:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tempestplugin/smoke_test.sh', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/helper.py', 'tricircle/network/local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/tempestplugin/smoke_test_validation.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/ed79a4d738f6234557ee391097250d7f61dd6a74', 'message': "Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway

1. What is the problem
We can create a subnet without gateway in the central Neutron, but when
we boot a VM in that subnet, the request fails since local Neutron is
trying to calculate the IP allocation pool based on the central subnet
gateway IP, which is None.

2. What is the solution for the problem
If a central subnet doesn't have gateway, do not re-calculate local IP
allocation pool when creating local subnet.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Support booting a VM in a subnet that has not gateway

Change-Id: I04f7f9f9926f22bca3490ee46e2163b9c17bb8fe
Closes-Bug: #1693446
"}]
commit_message:
Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway

1. What is the problem
We can create a subnet without gateway in the central Neutron, but when
we boot a VM in that subnet, the request fails since local Neutron is
trying to calculate the IP allocation pool based on the central subnet
gateway IP, which is None.

2. What is the solution for the problem
If a central subnet doesn't have gateway, do not re-calculate local IP
allocation pool when creating local subnet.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Support booting a VM in a subnet that has not gateway

Change-Id: I04f7f9f9926f22bca3490ee46e2163b9c17bb8fe
Closes-Bug: #1693446
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/62/467962/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
XenAPI: use os-xenapi 0.2.0 in nova

This patch is to change nova project to use os-xenapi 0.2.0 which
has added python interfaces for calling dom0 plugins
1. use os_xenapi.client.host_network
2. use os_xenapi.client.disk_management
3. use os_xenapi.client.vm_management
4. use os_xenapi.client.host_xenstore
5. use os_xenapi.client.host_agent
6. use os_xenapi.client.host_management
7. use os_xenapi.client.host_glance

Change-Id: Id87b83ef3ca496525f63b9c7b731e8a22c693e02

commit_message:
Set a "creator" rule for tempest

This patch set will set some configurations to the
local.conf then devstack will read the configurations
and move to tempest.conf file. It will help tempest have
a "creator" rule.

Change-Id: I47999eb6d3bcbec4434303040ba6dfad777490c2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-31 08:11:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/1840400b388aca3020a8df5470f789005745a1c4', 'message': 'Remove setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG in test_hook.sh

In the old version of the gates, we already set DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG
https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/47d2d8e9ec952a2f9d71fe7ab51e8bfd2c20ca64/jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml#L21

In the new (experimental) version of the gates (see
I68810330dbee4033f8198f39aba5b75cd3357399), we use thew new recommended
local_conf instead of DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG (see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html)

When we use local_conf in the new gates, DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG is not
needed and is not set. Thus, when test_hook.sh also sets
"enable_plugin barbican" in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG, DevStack attempts to
use both DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG and local_conf, and a duplicate config
error is thrown during the stacking.

commit_message:
Remove setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG in test_hook.sh

In the old version of the gates, we already set DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG
https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/47d2d8e9ec952a2f9d71fe7ab51e8bfd2c20ca64/jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml#L21

In the new (experimental) version of the gates (see
I68810330dbee4033f8198f39aba5b75cd3357399), we use thew new recommended
local_conf instead of DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG (see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html)

When we use local_conf in the new gates, DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG is not
needed and is not set. Thus, when test_hook.sh also sets
"enable_plugin barbican" in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG, DevStack attempts to
use both DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG and local_conf, and a duplicate config
error is thrown during the stacking.

Co-Authored-By: Nam Nguyen Hoai <namnh@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Idd94b900b238c865a4074ec7d1f9c1c16ef8d434

commit_message:
libvirt: update LibvirtConfigGuestDeviceAddress to provide XML

This commit is adding a method format_dom() to the config object
LibvirtConfigGuestDeviceAddress. That in the aim to provide full
description of the controller used by the device.

Closes-Bug: #1686116
Change-Id: I9620feffa74b8f7bc932eed03e3a60f46533681d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-02 16:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_common.yml', 'tasks/cinder_post_install.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_systemd.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/commit/6701d8c631e3e7cd1339794417f109ef1048d654', 'message': 'Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the

cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore

commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: Ia9df064ff145bec862e2a2cc0fd180a9188c5238
(cherry picked from commit fb807f2a607dfee37daf1fde90d52a71c66ac575)

This reverts commit 124ac0557a95ab092db549b6de8adcbe2cd80315.
The root cause of the gate issue is fixed in Nova
I142f97d691fa55e9824714c9c224f998ad72337e.

Change-Id: I50081d615b1d47215e1e35e62ac2cb14fb1c63ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/94/470994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(masahito) the try-except statement is a quick fix for nova's bug # https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1693438. After fixing the bug # remove the try-except. extra_timeout argument is added for ensuring # the server remains in BUILD status longer than instance boots time. try: waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.admin_manager.servers_client, server['id'], 'ERROR', raise_on_error=False, extra_timeout=100) except exceptions.TimeoutException: # check the server's status remains in BUILD status waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.admin_manager.servers_client, server['id'], 'BUILD')

commit_message:
Add member commands to client

This patch implements member create, list, show, set, and
delete within the openstack client.

Change-Id: Ic0555abeebcc2fcf536bb7608991c10354c6e13c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-octaviaclient refs/changes/35/463035/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy import mock from osc_lib import exceptions from osc_lib.tests.utils import ParserException from octaviaclient.osc.v2 import member from octaviaclient.tests.unit.osc.v2 import fakes as mem_fakes class TestMember(mem_fakes.TestLoadBalancerv2): mem = mem_fakes.FakeMember.create_member() columns = ( 'ID', 'Project ID', 'Provisioning Status', 'Address', 'Protocol Port', 'Operating Status', 'Weight' ) datalist = ( ( mem.id, mem.project_id, mem.provisioning_status, mem.address, mem.protocol_port, mem.operating_status, mem.weight ), ) info = { 'id': mem.id, 'project_id': mem.project_id, 'provisioning_status': mem.provisioning_status, 'address': mem.address, 'protocol_port': mem.protocol_port, 'operating_status': mem.operating_status, 'weight': mem.weight } mem_info = copy.deepcopy(info) def setUp(self): super(TestMember, self).setUp() self.mem_mock = self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.load_balancers self.mem_mock.reset_mock() self.api_mock = mock.Mock() self.api_mock.member_list.return_value = [self.mem_info] lb_client = self.app.client_manager lb_client.load_balancer = self.api_mock class TestListMember(TestMember): def setUp(self): super(TestListMember, self).setUp() self.cmd = member.ListMember(self.app, None) def test_member_list_no_options(self): arglist = [] verifylist = [] self.assertRaises(ParserException, self.check_parser, self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) @mock.patch('octaviaclient.osc.v2.member._get_pool') def test_member_list(self, mock_get_pool): mock_get_pool.return_value = {'id': 'pool_id'} arglist = ['pool_id'] verifylist = [] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.api_mock.member_list.assert_called_once_with(pool_id='pool_id') self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.datalist, tuple(data)) class TestCreateMember(TestMember): def setUp(self): super(TestCreateMember, self).setUp() self.cmd = member.CreateMember(self.app, None) self.api_mock.member_create.return_value = { 'member': self.mem_info} @mock.patch('octaviaclient.osc.v2.member._get_pool') def test_member_create(self, mock_get_pool): mock_get_pool.return_value = {'id': 'pool_id'} arglist = ['pool_id', '--address', '10.1.1.0', '--protocol_port', '80', '--weight', '1', '--enable'] verifylist = [ ('address', '10.1.1.0'), ('protocol_port', '80'), ('weight', '1') ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.api_mock.member_create.assert_called_with( pool_id='pool_id', json={'member': {'ip_address': '10.1.1.0', 'protocol_port': 80, 'weight': 1, 'admin_state_up': True}}) class TestMemberDelete(TestMember): def setUp(self): super(TestMemberDelete, self).setUp()

commit_message:
add libvirt-python for instance monitor.

libvirt-python is necessary when collect instance monitor information 
by telegraf, so add libvirt to telegraf image.

Change-Id: I1e859daca6af942f680c702783f841dd7874abe0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/42/464542/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: If4db8872c4f5705c1fff017c4891626e9ce4d1e4

commit_message:
Use config_number method instead of node_id + 1

Change-Id: I596a2ac947f7e5f9c0cb3286779ece5e40feefd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/13/471613/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: old_container_nodes = [ node for node, metadata in head_responses self.assertEqual(2, len(old_container_nodes)) for node in old_container_nodes: server.once(self.config_number(node))
deleted_lines: old_container_node_ids = [ node['id'] for node, metadata in head_responses self.assertEqual(2, len(old_container_node_ids)) tuple(server.once(number=n + 1) for n in old_container_node_ids)

commit_message:
Add new actions "power on" and "power off" in Watcher

This spec implements one of the features in bp "reduce power consumption".

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-power-on-off
Change-Id: Ieaac5cec650f2af424108f06aa66b8c986bece60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/36/435436/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Reduce power consumption ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/reduce-power-consumption The aim of this feature is to reduce power consumption using watcher. For a data center with large amount of VMs and physical hosts,the total power consumption is tremendous. With this feature, when the workload is low, watcher can consolidate VMs to several hosts and power off the rest hosts without VMs running on it to reduce power consumption, when the workload goes heavy,watcher can power on thoes hosts again and migrate VMs to them to ensure the QoS. Problem description =================== The telecommunication network traffic tidal [1] is an actual phenomena in the telecommunication. For example, during the daytime, large amount of users gather in the CBD[2] area and the workload of network traffic system is high. When they get off work, the user numbers declines rapidly and so does the network traffic workload. The problem is how to fulfill user network service requirements with minimal energy consumption given the changing network traffic workloads. As a real case from ZTE corporation, this problem is addressed by the following way. When the workload is low, we consolidate VMs to several hosts by live migration, and power off the hosts without VMs to reduce power consumption. Correspondingly, when the workload boosts, we power on those hosts again and lively migrate the VMs back to them. Use Cases ---------- As a deployer,when the workload is not high, I want watcher can automatically help to reduce the energy consumption by live migration VMs and reducing the number of running hosts. As a deployer,when the workload is heavy, I also want watcher can automatically help to ensure the user experience at the end by live migration and increasing the number of running hosts. Proposed change =============== Add a new goal:minimize the energy consumption Add a new strategy:reduce power consumption Add support to ironic in watcher,since ironic can be used to power on/off the physical hosts. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <li-canwei2> Other contributors: <alexchadin>,<hanrong>,<yumeng-bao> Work Items ---------- Implement a new goal:minimize energy consumption Implement a new strategy:reduce power consumption Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add the following tests. * Unit tests * Functional tests * Tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== Add a complete description of the new strategy to watcher doc References ========== [1]http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/7179335/ [2]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_business_district History ======= None .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Liberty - Introduced

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 02:07:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/103dafead915318a193a04b8a078168511f24f83', 'message': "Metadata update in local replicator site

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-07 18:33:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/bfc2d347b20ae59d2f898e106eabcde05c048381', 'message': "Metadata update in local replicator site

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-13 23:10:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c4d99b2da38e8273ce1611d0a94da00fb74a0f9a', 'message': "Update Metadata after 'sync' op in account/container replicator

In 'sync' call of account/container replicator, 'remote' site's
metadata is updated by using 'local' metadata, but on the other hand,
'local' side is not updated despite the existence of 'remote' metadata
in the response body of 'sync' call.

Account/Container replicator sometimes uses rsync for db sync if there is
big difference of record history in db files between 'local' and 'remote'
servers. If replicator needs to rsync local db to remote but metadata in
local db is older, older info of metadata can be distributed then some
metadata values can be missing. This problem can be simply fixed by
update 'local' metadata by 'remote' metadata in the response body of
'sync' call.

Closes-Bug: #1570118

metadata is updated by using 'local' metadata, but on the other hand,
'local' side is not updated despite the existence of 'remote' metadata

Account/Container replicator sometimes uses rsync for db sync if there is

Closes-Bug: #1570118

Change-Id: Icdf0a936fc456c5462471938cbc365bd012b05d4
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-26 19:17:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/5e1823979efd0bd40573dae2026522608c124dac', 'message': "Sync metadata in 'rsync_then_merge' in db_replicator

In previous 'rsync_then_merge' remote objects are merged with
rsync'ed local objects, but remote metadata is not merged with local
one. Account/Container replicator sometimes uses rsync for db sync if
there is a big difference of record history in db files between 'local'
and 'remote' servers. If replicator needs to rsync local db to remote
but metadata in local db is older, older info of metadata can be
distributed then some metadata values can be missing or go back to older.

This patch fixes this problem by merging 'remote' metadata with
rsync'ed local db file.

Plus, this patch simply fixed db_replicator to update 'local' metadata
by 'remote' metadata in the response body of 'sync' call to fix metadata
inconsistency faster.

commit_message:
Sync metadata in 'rsync_then_merge' in db_replicator

In previous 'rsync_then_merge' remote objects are merged with
rsync'ed local objects, but remote metadata is not merged with local
one. Account/Container replicator sometimes uses rsync for db sync if
there is a big difference of record history in db files between 'local'
and 'remote' servers. If replicator needs to rsync local db to remote
but metadata in local db is older, older info of metadata can be
distributed then some metadata values can be missing or go back to older.

This patch fixes this problem by merging 'remote' metadata with
rsync'ed local db file.

Closes-Bug: #1570118

Change-Id: Icdf0a936fc456c5462471938cbc365bd012b05d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/94/302494/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for instance actions endpoint

This patch adds instance actions related routes
by a plain list, instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova
API endpoints moves to the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore
for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I1ae0797ac8ca1cd64bb0d92d4c14aa96d4a59d62

subject: Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-19 03:36:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar/commit/752b233085314ac00b10ac443a04568178aea275', 'message': "Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager

Records in the reservations table in the Blazar DB are created and
updated by both of the mangaer and the resource plugin[1]. That
decreases a seperation of concerns.

This patch migrates such operations from the resource plugin to the
manager. It make the manager be responsible for the reservations table,
and the resource plugin be responsible only for resource specific tables
(e.g. computehost_reservations table).

It also changes the resource_id field in the reservations table to hold
an ID of the record of resource-specific reservations tables, e.g.
computehost_reservations table for the physical-host plugin and
instance_reservations talbe for the new instance plugin[2].
An ID of resource iteself which was held in the resource_id field is
migrated to the resource specific tables. So a new field 'aggregate_id'
is added into the computehost_rservations table.

The instance_reservations table of the new instance plugin is expected
to have resource IDs like a flavor ID, and aggregate ID, and instance
IDs. And the ID of the record of the instance_reservations table is
expected to be held in the resource_id field of the reservations table.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/blazar-resource-plugin
[2] I03315216c3a6203e088e914ffb9fedf1e672d732

Change-Id: Ia042020088af9e34e3430c44814cd69f4ed303fb

This patch migrates such operations from the resource plugin to the

instance_reservations talbe for the new instance plugin[2].
An ID of resource iteself which was held in the resource_id field is
migrated to the resource specific tables. So a new field 'aggregate_id'
is added into the computehost_rservations table.

The instance_reservations table of the new instance plugin is expected
to have resource IDs like a flavor ID, and aggregate ID, and instance
IDs. And the ID of the record of the instance_reservations table is
expected to be held in the resource_id field of the reservations table.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/blazar-resource-plugin

commit_message:
Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager

Records in the reservations table in the Blazar DB are created and
updated by both the manager and the resource plugin [1]. This results in
a lack of separation of concerns.

This patch migrates such operations from the resource plugin to the
manager. It makes the manager responsible for the reservations table,
and the resource plugin responsible only for resource specific tables
(e.g. the computehost_reservations table).

It also changes the resource_id field in the reservations table to hold
an ID of the record of resource-specific reservations tables, e.g.
computehost_reservations table for the physical-host plugin and
instance_reservations table for the new instance plugin [2].
An ID of resource itself which was held in the resource_id field is
migrated to the resource specific tables, so a new field 'aggregate_id'
is added into the computehost_rservations table.

The instance_reservations table of the new instance plugin is expected
to have resource IDs like a flavor ID, and aggregate ID, and instance
IDs. The ID of the record of the instance_reservations table is expected
to be held in the resource_id field of the reservations table.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/blazar-resource-plugin
[2] I03315216c3a6203e088e914ffb9fedf1e672d732

Change-Id: Ia042020088af9e34e3430c44814cd69f4ed303fb

commit_message:
Drop py34 target in tox.ini

We support py35 now.so it is no need to keep
the supoort for py34.

Change-Id: I28c32b8583776643c6fc6a6fb4833c0cd43540a7

commit_message:
use plain routes list for hypervisor endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds hypervisors related routes by a plain list,
instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves
to the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading
will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I1095e91b5ef84995b32b38445b0876b132b9627a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/459235/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Mount /var/run/libvirt on ceilo agent compute
revisions:

Add host logging for redis service template

other services.

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for server ips endpoint

This patch adds server ips related routes
by a plain list, instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova
API endpoints moves to the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore
for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I4c0a023ab295cdb0c71ff4800f288946215745ce

commit_message:
Remove deprecated oslo_messaging.get_transport

DeprecationWarning:
Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport.

Replace get_transport with get_notification_transport.

Change-Id: Ia32198e7e673154aeaa15757b1f733be61d8f58a

commit_message:
update semver module for python 3.5

Python 3 does not allow comparison between integers and strings. The
semver RulesTest class includes a case where the most recent tag is an
EOL name tag, and the comparison breaks under Python 3. This patch
modifies the comparison to skip over tags that can't be compared to only
look at numerical versions.

Depends-On: I9e56e1e5b0171f8ed4ae05c6aba36c4c733486fa
Change-Id: Id9ad068a279653ffb20c60d1752e41bb0e7bc5d1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/50/470350/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for latest_numerical_version in reversed(existing_versions): if type(latest_numerical_version[0]) != int: continue if new_version[0] > latest_numerical_version[0]: warnings.append( '%r is a major version increment over %r' % (format_version(new_version), format_version(latest_numerical_version)) ) break
deleted_lines: latest_version = existing_versions[-1] if new_version[0] > latest_version[0]: warnings.append( '%r is a major version increment over %r' % (format_version(new_version), format_version(latest_version)) )

commit_message:
Add Qinling pronunciation in README

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/53/471953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Qinling (is pronounced "tʃinliŋ") refers to Qinling Mountains in southern Shaanxi Province in China. The mountains provide a natural boundary between North and South China and support a huge variety of plant and wildlife, some of which is found nowhere else on Earth.
deleted_lines: Qinling refers to Qinling Mountains in southern Shaanxi Province in China. The mountains provide a natural boundary between North and South China and support a huge variety of plant and wildlife, some of which is found nowhere else on Earth.

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-fping endpoint

This patch adds os-fping related routes
by a plain list, instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova
API endpoints moves to the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore
for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Id58263258fe3cc28961fb095b4d758eef234ca47

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I5720eb69cfbbe24136ebdfcac9c68893b3595b27
(cherry picked from commit 0ca9a2c45ca9b38229b6efa7d553cc405e098246)

subject: Get BDMs when we need to in _handle_cell_delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-09 18:21:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/cells_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8bf45d864d5ac6cd1370c2a8f151bf4290a84eb2', 'message': "Get BDMs when we need to in _handle_cell_delete

The BDM list was originally added in this flow
in change Id68330eb238a304eaceefa7c0ec2fa0d2b60d28a
and it's only used for the _local_delete call but
over time with the cells v2 code it's been moved
away. This change moves the BDM query back to
right before _local_delete so we don't make an
unnecessary call in a semi-time sensitive code
path (because of the race between deleting the
instance in the API and the conductor deleting
the build request).

Change-Id: I6f4055adbc33701a39cf2b92eff101083a4f56f6
"}]
commit_message:
Get BDMs when we need to in _handle_cell_delete

The BDM list was originally added in this flow
in change Id68330eb238a304eaceefa7c0ec2fa0d2b60d28a
and it's only used for the _local_delete call but
over time with the cells v2 code it's been moved
away. This change moves the BDM query back to
right before _local_delete so we don't make an
unnecessary call in a semi-time sensitive code
path (because of the race between deleting the
instance in the API and the conductor deleting
the build request).

Change-Id: I6f4055adbc33701a39cf2b92eff101083a4f56f6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 17:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['tools/kubeadm-aio/kubeadm-aio-launcher.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/6ffd10403c2d8c4a09d4e2be65b252de8642e90a', 'message': 'Add sudo to docker log command

There are two spots where docker log is run without sudo, and
without sudo the command will usually fail and the loop will

Change-Id: I4335783478ad2583b581bd9264b029e929bfc8c3
'}]
commit_message:
Add sudo to docker log command

There are two spots where docker log is run without sudo, and
without sudo the command will usually fail and the loop will
never be exited. This would only be hit on an error.

Change-Id: I4335783478ad2583b581bd9264b029e929bfc8c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/75/471875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add vmware-nsx to project list

Ensure that vmware-nsx has updated requirements.
This was removed by commit 34edd0c89a18572c66ca2c0d69fe1b5536755f83
This was due to conflicts that we had and these have been resolved.

Depends-On: I0aa7e085c910c189384516dccd0922abef9334fa

Change-Id: Icbce3d6c318520127b1602840671eb8effdc215d

commit_message:
Filter services dictionary per host

To greatly reduce the amount of log noise from skipped tasks, set a
var in the role that filters the 'nova_services' dict to one that only
contains services relevant for each host.

Conflicts:
>------handlers/main.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_systemd.yml

Change-Id: I38ab4345f06ba6c9ef45cfe8e3ef48f2328b2333
(cherry picked from commit f2ed992208e4fdaa10a6c45a5797996d1ca20b51)

commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Conflicts:
>------handlers/main.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_common.yml
>------tasks/cinder_init_upstart.yml

Change-Id: Ia9df064ff145bec862e2a2cc0fd180a9188c5238
(cherry picked from commit fb807f2a607dfee37daf1fde90d52a71c66ac575)

commit_message:
Expose neutron api application as a wsgi script

This can then be loaded into a wsgi compatible web server like
apache2/httpd or nginx.

DocImpact A new neutron-api script is installed, and can be used to
start either a standalone wsgi server (calling the script directly),
or as a wsgi script loaded by a web server (e.g. by httpd/mod_wsgi).

Change-Id: Ie9bb8b33f6e1335219e574d832ac264b043d90e6
Partial-Bug: #1666779
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 429703a9a8781c38c709551a3cfed35ca3d2c574)

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I556eae42bfd69d3515272abd4ad8cc4bd68b397f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_monasca-ui refs/changes/20/470720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rework the 'oslo-config-generator' documentation

There's a lot of shuffling docs around, but the main point is to
document the application parameters and the support for multiple output
formats recently added.

Change-Id: I26827801df917619d4256ef4c718051f5c395a29
Implements: bp machine-readable-sample-config
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/54/471854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `oslo-config-generator` is a utility for generating sample config files in a variety of formats. Sample config files list all of the available options, along with their help string, type, deprecated aliases and defaults. These sample files can be used as config files for `oslo.config` itself (``ini``) or by configuration management tools (``json``, ``yaml``). .. versionadded:: 1.4.0 .. versionchanged:: 4.3.0 The :option:`oslo-config-generator --format` parameter was added, which allows outputting in additional formats. Usage ----- .. program:: oslo-config-generator .. code-block:: shell oslo-config-generator --namespace <namespace> [--namespace <namespace> ...] [--output-file <output-file>] [--wrap-width <wrap-width>] [--format <format>] [--minimal] [--summarize] .. option:: --namespace <namespace> Option namespace under ``oslo.config.opts`` in which to query for options. .. option:: --output-file <output-file> Path of the file to write to. :Default: stdout .. option:: --wrap-width <wrap-width> The maximum length of help lines. :Default: 70 .. option:: --format <format> Desired format for the output. ``ini`` is the only format that can be used directly with `oslo.config`. ``json`` and ``yaml`` are intended for third-party tools that want to write config files based on the sample config data. For more information, refer to :ref:`machine-readable-configs`. :Choices: ini, json, yaml .. option:: --minimal Generate a minimal required configuration. .. option:: --summarize Only output summaries of help text to config files. Retain longer help text for Sphinx documents. For example, to generate a sample config file for `oslo.messaging` you would run: .. code-block:: shell $ oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging > oslo.messaging.conf To generate a sample config file for an application ``myapp`` that has its own options and uses `oslo.messaging`, you would list both namespaces: .. code-block:: shell $ oslo-config-generator --namespace myapp \ --namespace oslo.messaging > myapp.conf To generate a sample config file for `oslo.messaging` in `JSON` format, you would run: .. code-block:: shell $ oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging \ --format json > oslo.messaging.confThe :option:`oslo-config-generator --namespace` option specifies an entry point name registered under the ``oslo.config.opts`` entry point namespace. For example, in the `oslo.messaging` ``setup.cfg`` we have: .. code-block:: inia list of ``(group, [opt_1, opt_2])`` tuples, where ``group`` is either a group name as a string or an ``OptGroup`` object. Passing the ``OptGroup`` object allows the consumer of the ``list_opts`` method to access and publish group help. An example, using both styles: .. code-block:: python from oslo_config import cfg opts1 = [ cfg.StrOpt('foo'), cfg.StrOpt('bar'), ] opts2 = [ cfg.StrOpt('baz'), ] baz_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='baz_group' title='Baz group options', help='Baz group help text') cfg.CONF.register_group(baz_group) cfg.CONF.register_opts(opts1, group='blaa') cfg.CONF.register_opts(opts2, group=baz_group) def list_opts(): # Allows the generation of the help text for # the baz_group OptGroup object. No help # text is generated for the 'blaa' group. return [('blaa', opts1), (baz_group, opts2)].. code-block:: ini [entry_points] oslo.config.opts.defaults = keystone = keystone.common.config:update_opt_defaults.. code-block:: python.. _machine-readable-configs: Generating Machine Readable Configs ----------------------------------- All deployment tools have to solve a similar problem: how to generate the config files for each service at deployment time. To help with this problem, `oslo-config-generator` can generate machine-readable sample config files that output the same data as the INI files used by `oslo.config` itself, but in a YAML or JSON format that can be more easily consumed by deployment tools. .. important:: The YAML and JSON-formatted files generated by `oslo-config-generator` cannot be used by `oslo.config` itself - they are only for use by other tools. For example, some YAML-formatted output might look like so: .. code-block:: yaml generator_options: config_dir: [] config_file: [] format_: yaml minimal: false namespace: - keystone output_file: null summarize: false wrap_width: 70 options: DEFAULT: help: '' opts: - advanced: false choices: [] default: null deprecated_for_removal: false deprecated_opts: [] deprecated_reason: null deprecated_since: null dest: admin_token help: Using this feature is *NOT* recommended. Instead, use the `keystone-manage bootstrap` command. The value of this option is treated as a "shared secret" that can be used to bootstrap Keystone through the API. This "token" does not represent a user (it has no identity), and carries no explicit authorization (it effectively bypasses most authorization checks). If set to `None`, the value is ignored and the `admin_token` middleware is effectively disabled. However, to completely disable `admin_token` in production (highly recommended, as it presents a security risk), remove `AdminTokenAuthMiddleware` (the `admin_token_auth` filter) from your paste application pipelines (for example, in `keystone-paste.ini`). max: null metavar: null min: null mutable: false name: admin_token namespace: keystone positional: false required: false sample_default: null secret: true short: null type: string value - ... ... deprecated_options: DEFAULT: - name: bind_host replacement_group: eventlet_server replacement_name: public_bind_host where the top-level keys are: ``generator_options`` The options passed to the :program:`oslo-config-generator` tool itself ``options`` All options registered in the provided namespace(s). These are grouped under the ``OptGroup`` they are assigned to which defaults to ``DEFAULT`` if unset. For information on the various attributes of each option, refer to :doc:`opts`. ``deprecated_options`` All **deprecated** options registered in the provided namespace(s). Like ``options``, these options are grouped by ``OptGroup``. register multiple entry points: .. code-block:: ini.. code-block:: shell $ oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging \ $ oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging \files: .. code-block:: shell $ cat > config-generator/api.conf <<EOF [DEFAULT] output_file = etc/nova/nova-api.conf namespace = oslo.messaging namespace = nova.common namespace = nova.api EOF $ cat > config-generator/compute.conf <<EOF [DEFAULT] output_file = etc/nova/nova-compute.conf namespace = oslo.messaging namespace = nova.common namespace = nova.compute EOF $ oslo-config-generator --config-file config-generator/api.conf $ oslo-config-generator --config-file config-generator/compute.confwas generated, you might want to include something like ``10.0.0.1``. To facilitate this, options can be supplied with a ``sample_default`` attribute: .. code-block:: python cfg.StrOpt('base_dir' default=os.getcwd(), sample_default='/usr/lib/myapp')
deleted_lines: oslo-config-generator is a utility for generating sample config files. For example, to generate a sample config file for oslo.messaging you would run:: $> oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging > oslo.messaging.conf This generated sample lists all of the available options, along with their help string, type, deprecated aliases and defaults. To generate a sample config file for an application ``myapp`` that has its own options and uses oslo.messaging, you can list both namespaces:: $> oslo-config-generator --namespace myapp --namespace oslo.messaging > myapp.conf .. versionadded:: 1.4The ``--namespace`` option specifies an entry point name registered under the 'oslo.config.opts' entry point namespace. For example, in oslo.messaging's setup.cfg we have::a list of (``group``, [opt_1, opt_2]) tuples, where ``group`` is either a group name as a string or an ``OptGroup`` object. Passing the ``OptGroup`` object allows the consumer of the ``list_opts`` method to access and publish group help. An example, using both styles:: opts1 = [ cfg.StrOpt('foo'), cfg.StrOpt('bar'), ] opts2 = [ cfg.StrOpt('baz'), ] baz_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='baz_group' title='Baz group options', help='Baz group help text') cfg.CONF.register_group(baz_group) cfg.CONF.register_opts(opts1, group='blaa') cfg.CONF.register_opts(opts2, group=baz_group) def list_opts(): # Allows the generation of the help text for # the baz_group OptGroup object. No help # text is generated for the 'blaa' group. return [('blaa', opts1), (baz_group, opts2)]:: [entry_points] oslo.config.opts.defaults = keystone = keystone.common.config:update_opt_defaults::register multiple entry points:: $> oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging \ $> oslo-config-generator --namespace oslo.messaging \files:: $> cat > config-generator/api.conf <<EOF [DEFAULT] output_file = etc/nova/nova-api.conf namespace = oslo.messaging namespace = nova.common namespace = nova.api EOF $> cat > config-generator/compute.conf <<EOF [DEFAULT] output_file = etc/nova/nova-compute.conf namespace = oslo.messaging namespace = nova.common namespace = nova.compute EOF $> oslo-config-generator --config-file config-generator/api.conf $> oslo-config-generator --config-file config-generator/compute.confwas generated, you might want to include something like '10.0.0.1'. To facilitate this, options can be supplied with a 'sample_default' attribute:: cfg.StrOpt('base_dir' default=os.getcwd(), sample_default='/usr/lib/myapp')

commit_message:
Correct reno list formatting

This commit formats lists correctly in patrole renos which are

commit_message:
Ensure that role tests pin pip/setuptools/wheel

Currently the role tests use whatever versions of pip,
setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

commit_message:
Fix a misnamed file

A template file was misspelt with ``_babican.sh.tpl``.  This patch
set renames this to ``_barbican.sh.tpl``.

Change-Id: I3e3664d6711b6d0d0de2f8de28d6caa43f783548

setuptools and wheel are already installed on the host.

When a version of these tools changes it often causes
problems for our testing.

This will ensure that we use a known good set of pins
which is maintained in the general SHA bumping process.

Change-Id: I60c75e5a5f189301d6ed9978fb268d0e6f092b30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_watcher refs/changes/29/470729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
sphinxext: Log with 'str', not 'repr'

The latter results in 'u' prefixes to most strings, and 'str' generally
exposes something more human-readable than 'repr'.

Change-Id: I8cf0cc0593341c92a6798e75ee2aeff3115ebda5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/11/471811/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Don't treat service as enabled if in disabled list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-30 21:12:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/7f7735b7c628a2c31c429b021d42a67c8e4263d8', 'message': "Don't treat service as enabled if in disabled list

The old implementation for is_$service_enabled simply checked if any of
the subservices were enabled and if so the service was considered to be
enabled. This makes disabling services complicated as it means you have
to list every single subservice which can and do change over time.

Instead also check if the generic service name is in the disabled
services list and if so don't treat the service as enabled.

Change-Id: I7fe4dfca2cd9c15069d50a04161a29c5638291cb
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-07 17:23:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/template', 'lib/nova', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/swift', 'lib/glance'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/902158bb8fb8452d747225e5986fb789828e4e67', 'message': "Don't treat service as enabled if in disabled list

The old implementation for is_$service_enabled simply checked if any of
the subservices were enabled and if so the service was considered to be
enabled. This makes disabling services complicated as it means you have
to list every single subservice which can and do change over time.

Instead also check if the generic service name is in the disabled
services list and if so don't treat the service as enabled.

Change-Id: I7fe4dfca2cd9c15069d50a04161a29c5638291cb
"}]
commit_message:
Don't treat service as enabled if in disabled list

The old implementation for is_$service_enabled simply checked if any of
the subservices were enabled and if so the service was considered to be
enabled. This makes disabling services complicated as it means you have
to list every single subservice which can and do change over time.

Instead also check if the generic service name is in the disabled
services list and if so don't treat the service as enabled.

Change-Id: I7fe4dfca2cd9c15069d50a04161a29c5638291cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/53/469253/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
added functionality to main to create a session, delete a session based on an identifier url, and to delete the active session. Also added functionality to retrieve a session collection, and a session.

Change-Id: I026d677d5f426d40500f6471b7318e0872a5346c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/31/471931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sushy.resources.sessionservice import sessionservice, session def _get_sessionservice_path(self): """Helper function to find the SessionService path""" session_service_col = self.json.get('SessionService') if not session_service_col: raise exceptions.MissingAttributeError(attribute='SessionService', resource=self._path) return session_service_col.get('@odata.id') def create_session(self): """Creates a session for secure access. :raises: MissingAttributeError, if it cannot find SessionService path :returns: session that was created """ sess_serv = sessionservice.SessionService(self._conn, self._get_sessionservice_path(), redfish_version=self.redfish_version) session_key, session_uri = sess_serv._create_session() if session_key is None: return None new_session = session.Session(self._conn, session_uri, self.redfish_version) return new_session def close_active_session(self): """ Closes the active session we are using. :param identity: The identity of the System resource """ sess_serv = sessionservice.SessionService(self._conn, self._get_sessionservice_path(), redfish_version=self.redfish_version) session_key, session_uri = self._conn._get_session_info() sess_serv._delete_session(session_key, session_uri) def close_session(self, identity): """ Closes a session. This is useful in case user notices mutliple open sessions. They can close non-active sessions. :param identity: The identity of the System resource """ sess_serv = sessionservice.SessionService(self._conn, self._get_sessionservice_path(), redfish_version=self.redfish_version) session_key, session_uri = self._conn._get_session_info() sess_serv._delete_session(session_key, identity) def get_session_collection(self): """Get the SessionCollection object :raises: MissingAttributeError, if the collection attribue is not found :returns: as SessionCollection object """ return session.SessionCollection(self._conn, self._get_sessionservice_path() + "/Sessions", redfish_version=self.redfish_version) def get_session(self, identity): """Given the identity return a Session object :param identity: The identity of the session resource :returns: The Session object """ return session.Session(self._conn, identity, redfish_version=self.redfish_version)

added_lines: @mock.patch.object(connector.Connector, '_op', autospec=True) def test_delete(self, mock__op): self.conn.delete(path='fake/path', data=self.data, headers=self.headers) mock__op.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, 'DELETE', 'fake/path', self.data, self.headers) def test_ok_post_with_session(self): self.conn._add_session_key('asdf1234', '/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/asdf1234') expected_headers = self.headers.copy() expected_headers['Content-Type'] = 'application/json' expected_headers['X-Auth-Token'] = 'asdf1234' self.conn._op('POST', path='fake/path', data=self.data, headers=self.headers) self.conn._delete_session_key() self.request.assert_called_once_with( 'POST', 'http://foo.bar:1234/fake/path', data=json.dumps(self.data), headers=expected_headers) def test_session_info(self): session_key, session_uri = self.conn._get_session_info() self.assertEqual(session_key, None) self.assertEqual(session_uri, None) self.conn._add_session_key('asdf1234', '/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/asdf1234') session_key, session_uri = self.conn._get_session_info() self.assertEqual(session_key, 'asdf1234') self.assertEqual(session_uri, '/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/asdf1234') self.conn._delete_session_key() session_key, session_uri = self.conn._get_session_info() self.assertEqual(session_key, None) self.assertEqual(session_uri, None)

added_lines: Please note that some vendors require users to authenticate via the Redfish Session Login Authentication before exposing any functionality. This can be achieved via a call to create_session(). Also note that Redfish sessions "time-out" as opposed to having a token expiration time like some tokenbased methods use. For Redfish sessions, as long a client continues to send requests for the session more often than the session timeout period, the session will remain open and the session auth token remains valid. If the sessions times-out then the session is automatically terminated. # Create session IF our client requires it session = s.create_session() # Close our active session s.close_active_session() # The above can also be achieved using either command below session.close() s.close_session(session.path)

deleted_lines: Please note that some vendors require users to authenticate via the Redfish Session Login Authentication before exposing any functionality. This can be achieved via a call to create_session(). Also note that Redfish sessions "time-out" as opposed to having a token expiration time like some tokenbased methods use. For Redfish sessions, as long a client continues to send requests for the session more often than the session timeout period, the session will remain open and the session auth token remains valid. If the sessions times-out then the session is automatically terminated.

commit_message:
added session_key and session_uri attributes for active session that maybe generated depending on platform. Also created functions to create the session_key and session_uri and delete them. Also created one to retrieve them. Added section in _op to check if we have a session_key, if we do, add it to the headers['X-Auth-Token']

Change-Id: I0874a481f5d25696b9ad6f7af30290e33c011b7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/30/471930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.session_key = None self.session_uri = None def _add_session_key(self, session_key, session_uri): """Adds a session key if needed by certain clients""" self.session_key = session_key self.session_uri = session_uri def _delete_session_key(self): """Removes session key if no longer needed""" self.session_key = None self.session_uri = None def _get_session_info(self): """ Retrieves the session info""" return self.session_key, self.session_uri if self.session_key is not None: headers['X-Auth-Token'] = self.session_key def delete(self, path='', data=None, headers=None): """HTTP DELETE method. :param path: Optional sub-URI path to the resource. :param data: Optional JSON data. :param headers: Optional dictionary of headers. :returns: The response object from the requests library. :raises: ConnectionError :raises: HTTPError """ return self._op('DELETE', path, data, headers)

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-services endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-services related routes by a plain list, instead of
using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to the plain
routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be removed from
Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Ib145494b9fc3c660176098e4168cf72db507f34d

commit_message:
Raise exception when get_disks() cannot get 'TYPE' column

This commit makes get_disks() raise an exception when it cannot get
'TYPE' column. In most of new linux distros, this cannot be happened,
however, in old distros, the 'TYPE' column doesn't exist. In that
situation, this could be useful for debugging and it's easy to
understand what is the root cause.

Change-Id: I328f1c2ea80478a00432f51e77ffd12036829430
Related-Bug: #1673607
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/66/450066/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif pos is not None and pos > 0 and l[pos:pos + 4] == "disk": if selected: return "\n".join(selected) else: msg = "'TYPE' column is requred but the output doesn't have it: " raise tempest.lib.exceptions.TempestException(msg + output)
